Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia Rita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Julia; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía y muñequería, también bisutería, la socia elabora a mano las muñecas de trapo con traje típicos, la socia trabaja junto a sus parientes ella gusta mucho de realizar estas muñecas con detalles muy distintivos, pero hay muchas ocasiones en las que la socia no se abastece y pide a sus proveedores que le vendan al por mayor diferentes trabajos hechos por gente local en sus pueblos de origen, la socia ahora desea el préstamo para poder comprar materiales para realizar sus muñecas y una de sus hijas hace los aretes a mano y también le dará parte del crédito para sus materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus trabajo de artesanía (muñecas de trapo y aretes).

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "INTI QUILLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Julia is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her business is buying and selling handicrafts, dolls and jewelry.  She makes rag dolls wearing traditional dress by hand.  She works together with her relatives and really enjoys making these dolls with very distinctive details.  However, there are many occasions when she can't make enough of them and then she asks her suppliers to sell her different work done by local people in their native villages wholesale.

Julia would like this loan so that she can buy material for making her dolls.  One of her daughters makes earrings by hand and she will give some of the loan money to her daughter so that she can buy materials.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making her handicrafts (rag dolls and earrings).

Julia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying materials for making her handicrafts (rag dolls and earrings)

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is twenty-four years old, living with his parents in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his siblings up to degree level. He is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for three years now. John needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Rosa Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita. Rosa es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive por el sector de Narancay Bajo  que se encuentra a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, en este sector su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura y también mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.
 
La Señorita. Rosa J. tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres la misma que es propia, su mamá se dedica a la venta de chancho asado y su papa es de profesión chofer.
> 
Nuestra socia se dedica a ayudar en el negocio de su madre en donde trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 2 años y  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para la venta. Su meta es crecer en el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Srta. Rosa is a member of the San Pablo Communal Bank. She lives in the Narancay Bajo sector, which is located ten minutes away from the city of Cuenca. The residents of this sector engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture. Many of them also work in the city in different businesses.

Srta. Rosa J. is 27 years old, single, and lives at the home of her parents which she calls her own. Her mother sells roasted pork and her father is a professional driver.

Rosa helps with her mother’s business and works Sunday through Sunday from 7am to 8pm. She has been with her Communal Bank for two years and the money from this loan will be invested in pork to sell. Her goal is to grow the family business.

loans.use: Purchase pork

loans.name: Simion Njenga

texts.en:
Simion has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 49 years old, married to Rebecca Wamaitha, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He paid back all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy three cows and 10 sheep which he will raise for slaughter.

In future, Simion wants to build rental houses to diversify his income.

loans.use: To buy three cows and 10 sheep which he will raise for slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction supplies for his house

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: hog raising and rice retailing. She lives in Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Estelita is borrowing PHP 19,000 to purchase feeds for her hog and rice to sell. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Estelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and rice

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 33 سنة يعمل في بيع وتصليح الكومبيوتر له في عمله 6 سنوات يعمل بشكل جيد وله زبائن من محيطه وجرانه يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يحسن وضعه يسعى الى تغيير الواقع المادي والاجتماعي له يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة يواجه  صعوبة بعدم توفير الامكانيات اللازمة يحلم بتكبير محله حتى يصبح مؤسسة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كومبيوترات جديدة والعاب وخطوط لتعبئة الهواتف يعمل بنشاط لافت وحب للعمل
texts.en: Ali is 33 and sells and repairs computers for a living. He has 6 years’ experience in this, and has many local customers. He wants to increase his income and thereby improve his prospects and his financial and social situation. With this loan he wants to purchase necessities that he currently can't afford for his store, such as new computers, games and phone lines. He dreams of expanding his store into a company. He is enthusiastic and loves his job.

loans.use: to purchase new computers, games and other necessities for his store

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir S. was born in 1963. He lives in Yerevan with his wife, two sons, daughter-in-law, and grandchild. 

From 1984 till 2003 Vladimir worked in Armenian International Airports as an operator. Vladimir's parents have lived in Kazakhstan and invited him and his family to live there, but Vladimir decided to run his own business in his motherland. 

For about eight years Vladimir has engaged in shoe production and trading. He produces shoes by himself and sells them in a rented stall, which is located in one of Yerevan's trade markets. Also he buys shoes to resell from other shoemakers. His sons help him in business and thanks to their business incomes they support their family. 

Vladimir is asking for a 700,000 Armenian Dram (AMD) loan to buy and to produce shoes for his business.

loans.use: to buy and to produce shoes for his business

loans.name: Cristian Antonio

texts.es:
Cristino, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, inicio su negocio junto a su esposa, trabajan en lo propio y no tiene un horario fijo.
El solicita préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes, así también comprar cerdos para comercializar,  esta compra le permitirá poder cosechar y aumentar la granja de cerdos, también en un futuro recibir mejores ganancias de su trabajo.
El quiere ampliar el negocio, trabajar fuertemente por las necesidades de su familia y ofrecerles una vida confortable.
texts.en: Cristian lives in San Rafael Oriente, department of San Miguel, and makes a living in livestock and agriculture. He lives with his wife and two children. He started his business along with his wife, and they work on their own land and don't have a fixed schedule. He's requesting the loan to purchase manure and fertilizers as well as pigs to sell. This purchase will allow him to be able to harvest his crops and expand his pig farm, and also in the future make more for his work. He wants to expand his business and works very hard to provide his family with necessities and offer them a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers as well as pigs to sell

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is 53 years old, married with four sons. Two of them work while the other two are studying. The eldest one is a computer operator in a private organization while the 2nd one is a computer embroidery expert. 

Zahida herself is a housewife as well as a working woman. She operates a sewing business for her neighboring clients and charges 100-150 PKRs per dress. Due to her quality of sewing, she receives good number of orders every month. The income she earns helps her to pay off the utilities. Besides her work, she also manages her household responsibilities very well. 

Her husband is a vegetable vendor and sells vegetables in the vegetable market. He is very experienced in his work and has been operating this business for many years. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. Through the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress. 

She is hopeful that by purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to complete the orders in less time and earn better profits.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Lorife

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorife, 25 years of age and married, is a resident of Garang, Tangub City, Mis. Occ. She is married to a single motor driver. They were blessed with two children, who both are old enough to attend school. That has created a financial strain for their family. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC two years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. PMPC is one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and was awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

Since she is receiving her third loan, she is requesting PHP7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. The future income from this loan will be used for daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, 56 years old, has been a scavenger since 2001. His wife is a farmer. They both can get $7 per day for their income. He has one daughter, 25 years old, who stays in Phnom Penh. 

Every month, he has to spend $33 on food, $3 on electricity, and $5 for other expenses. 

Before he had only a cart, so he walked to buy the recycled things from the villagers. He couldn't go to buy things in the other village because it is too far, so he bought a bicycle to make his career easier. But now he prefers a motorbike because his career is getting better. He can make a good profit if he has a motorbike to transport those recycle things to sell.

He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike that can help his career. Besides extending this career, he also wants to buy more agriculture land to plant crops such as corn and potato with his wife.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to expand the range of his recycling career.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Una madre muy esforzada es Cecilia, que cuida de sus 2 hijos  en la propiedad de sus padres que heredará a futuro. Tras la carencia económica, a pesar de tener un sueldo fijo como secretaria, vio la necesidad de tener un negocio. Ya son 2 años que ha tomado esta decisión, de vender cosméticos y productos de lencería a personas que conoce. Desde entonces los lleva a vender a sus clientes, ofreciéndolos en sus casas, dejándoles a crédito. Siempre mantiene el orden en su negocio, procura anotar el control de los productos que vende y de las deudas pendientes de cada cliente que tiene. Ahora se ha fijado metas para el futuro, ya que  su negocio le ha traído buenas ganancias. Por tanto en adelante desea tener más mercadería y más clientes. Fue invitada a trabajar con MFP  de manera grupal y eso fue para ella una gran oportunidad de desarrollo que la impulsa a crecer y mejorar su actual negocio. Es reconocida por 4 oportunidades de crédito que tuvo, pues ahora desea renovar su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que espera de ustedes, comprará más mercadería de temporada y de esa manera incrementara su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: A hardworking mother - that's Cecilia, who takes care of her two children in her parents' house, which she will inherit in the future. With the economic downturn and being on a fixed income, she saw the need to have a business. She made this decision two years ago, to sell cosmetics and lingerie to people she knows. Since then, she has been selling to more customers, working with them in their homes, selling to them on credit. She always maintains order in her business; she attempts to record all the products she sells and the pending credit that each customer has. She has now set goals for the future since her business has brought in good revenue. In the future she would like to have more merchandise and more customers. She was invited to work with Kiva partner MFP through a group, and this was a great opportunity for her to develop her drive to grow and improve her business. She has received four loans in the past, and she now wants to renew her involvement and continue making her payments on time. With the loan she hopes to receive from you, she will purchase more seasonal merchandise and thus increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
41-year-old Hayk lives in Ddmashen village, in the area of Sevan. He is married and has three children.  His wife stays at home and doesn’t work and his children attend school. Hayk graduated from an industrially-technological secondary school and by profession, he is a flour production technologist. After graduation, he worked at Ddmashen village Sovkhoz as supplies manager. After that, he worked at different construction companies. 

Since 2001, Hayk’s main line of business is farming. Thanks to his wife’s help, he breeds cows, sheep and chickens, and grows potatoes and garlic. Hayk sells his agricultural products at market or sells them to his neighbors.
  
Hayk has received a loan from Nor Horizon three times and he has never delayed his repayments. Now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and a motorized cultivator, which helps him to increase land cultivation efficiency.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and a motorized cultivator

loans.name: Las Reinas Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS REYNAS FORTALEZA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rufina quien en la fotrografia es la que tiene lentes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, kiosco de salchipapas, kiosco de dulces y venta de comida, venta de habas y chicharrones, costura de bolsas, tienda de dulces, producción de mochilas, producción de mantas.

La señora Rufina,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de material de librería que inicio desde hace doce años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la incrementar su capital (compra de cuadernos, hojas y lápices) que comprará por mayor de la Ceja y 16 de Julio y que posteriormente lo venderá en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.

En la fotografia falta la señora Wilma porque estuvo en consulta en el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Reynas Fortalieza” (The Queens of Fortitutde) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. The group consists of nine members and is lead by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Rufina, who is the woman in the photograph wearing glasses. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various businesses to get ahead such as carpentry, running a “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes) kiosk, running a candy kiosk, selling food, selling beans and pork, sewing handbags, selling sweets, producing backpacks, and producing blankets.

Sra. Rufina says this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by a promoter. She currently manages a bookstore that she started 12 years ago.

Her loan will be used to increase her capital for buying notebooks, sheets of paper, and pencils. She buys in bulk in the neighborhoods of La Ceja and July 16th and then sells her merchandise at home. Working in this manner allows her to generate income to support her family. Rufina is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rufina said she enjoys the health services.

Sra. Wilma does not appear in the photograph because she was at the health clinic.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, sheets of paper, and pencils.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 52. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Victor, a cook. She is a mother to her three children. Her eldest child is in college and the youngest is staying at home.  She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Elvira earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located inside her house. At the same time, she earns additional income by sewing or repairing clothes and pants. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvira hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell in her store

loans.name: Serigne Bassirou

texts.fr: -Monsieur  Bassirou  est un jeune sénégalais marié  âgé de 37 ans, qui évolue dans la vente des pièces détachées auto et le  montage depuis plusieurs années. Il a choisit son métier  par amour dans le but d’avoir une source de revenu  et  de subvenir à ses besoins. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est la satisfaction qu’il procure  a sa clientèle. Il est  sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 4 mois. Il sollicite un prêt de 350 000. Avec son financement, il prévoit d’acheter  des pièces détachées qui seront destinées à la vente afin de mieux développer son activité. L’augmentation de son fond de roulement  lui permettra  de réaliser ses projets futurs  et  d’accroitre ses bénéfices, pour mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr Ibrahima is a young Senegalese man of 37 years who has been selling and installing spare car parts for the past several years. He chose this career because he loves it and in order to have a source of income to meet his needs. What he likes most in his work is satisfying his clients. He is a member of one of UIMCEC's branches for the past 4 months. He is asking for a loan of 350,000 CFA Francs. With the loan, he would like to buy spare parts that will be resold in order to expand his business. The expansion of this working capital will allow him to create new projects in the future and to grow his profits in order to take better care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús resiD. en su propia casa con su hija la cual ya es mayor D. edad. Ella posee un pequeño chalet en el cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad como: frijoles, pan dulce, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, detergente, entre otros. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que no se cansa D. trabajar y luchar por mejorar su situación económica y la D. su familia. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que ella es muy dedicada, amable y sobre todo responsable. Siempre atienD. a sus clientes con una sonrisa y con mucha disposición. Todo esto ha permitido que las personas le tengan confianza y la prefieran a la hora D. realizar sus compras. Jesús a decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio y poder surtirlo D. diferentes artículos D. tienda como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, pan dulce, aceite, papel, y D. mas productos que resulten atractivos para los clientes. Confía en Dios que D. esta forma su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia cambiará.
texts.en:
Jesús lives in her own home together with her grown-up daughter.  Jesús owns a small place where she sells essential household products such as beans, sweet bread, rice, sugar, candies, detergent, etc.  She is a very hard-working woman who never tires of working and struggling to improve her own financial situation and that of her family.  She has a lot of customers as she is very dedicated, kind and, above all, responsible.  She always serves her customers with a smile and good will.  This has led to people trusting her and preferring to buy from her.

Jesús has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business and stock it with different goods such as rice, sugar, beans, candies, sweet bread, oil, paper and other products which appeal to her customers.  She trusts in God that, as a result, her own quality of life and that of her family will change.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, candies, sweet bread, oil, paper, etc.

loans.name: Khalila

texts.en:
Khalila is a divorced woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past year, Khalila has operated an ice cube and fresh water sales business, selling from home to her neighboring community members. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 
With this loan of 80,000 KES, she wants to purchase a freezer for storing ice cubes and establish a charcoal sales stall. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for storing ice cubes and establish a charcoal sales stall.

loans.name: Kulgaaky

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность Кива инвесторам за поддержку и финансирование первого кредита Кулгаакы по линии Кива, который был выплачен без просрочек. 
Кулгаакы  47 лет, замужем и имеет двух детей.  Кулгаакы работает учителем английского языка в местной школе, а также преподает в университете и известна как ответственный, честный и принципиальный человек.  В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кулгаакы занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Семейный бизнес в разведении скота и выращивании фасоли, в ведении которого ей помогает муж,  приносит Кулгаакы около 9,000 сом ежемесячно.    Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулгаакы обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушу м и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом на покупку коровы и оплаты сбора урожая фасоли.  Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на покупку строй материалов для постройки ограждения.
texts.en: "Bai Tushum and Partners" company expresses a sincere gratitude to Kiva investors, who supported and financed Kulgaaky's first loan through Kiva, which was repaid without delays.  Kulgaaky is 47 years old, married and has two children.  She works as an English language teacher at the local school and also teaches at a university.  She is known as a responsible, honest and principled person.  As a secondary income for her family, Kulgaaky is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  The family business of breeding livestock and growing beans, with which her husband helps, yields Kulgaaky about 9,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Kulgaaky requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a cow and pay for beans harvest gathering.  She plans to use the profits from the loan to buy construction materials to build a fence.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and pay for harvest gathering

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 40-years-old and married with 4 children, ages between 4 and 22. She runs a bar and restaurant in Kissy in the eastern part of Freetown. She also takes care of three relative as well as her immediate family.  

Isatu has owns this business for 20 years and sells beer, Maltina, soft drinks, and preparing food at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks and food stuff.  Isatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to open another out let.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, maltina and preparing food.

loans.name: Verbina

texts.en:
Verbina is 36 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

Verbina works in the fish industry and sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has been requested a loan of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase dried fish to sell.

Verbina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Verbina hopes to become a supplier of dried fish in the province.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sapenzia Kasiala

texts.en: Sapenzia is a 63-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 30 to 40 years. She describes herself to be polite, patient, and ambitious. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenges to be seasonality and price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Flordeliza has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & candies. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, beverages & candies.

Flordeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & candies

loans.name: Millicent Nyiero

texts.en:
Millicent 45 years old, married and has five children ranging from one to thirteen years old. She describes herself as a humble woman. 
She has been a tailor for the last four years. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of materials and clothes. In the future, she wants to run and expand a large tailoring shop business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Lelia Leonor

texts.es:
Lelia es una mujer de 27 años que vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 8 años en la Cooperativa "Santa Martha" en Santo Domingo en el Ecuador. Santo Domingo es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador después de Guayaquil, Quito y Cuenca. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. La provincia tiene de superficie 3.857 km² - 352.300 ha a una altitud de 625 msnm. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Lelia tiene un negocio de comida rápida desde hace algunos años; nos cuenta que lo aprendió de unos amigos. Es cliente de Fundación Alternativa, quien le ayuda con préstamos para su negocio y hoy Ella quiere invertir en mejoras de su local. Fundación Alternativa brinda, además de servicios financieros, servicios NO financieros que van desde la asesoría hasta la capacitación y Lelia asiste a ellas porque los temas le parecen interesantes.

Su sueño es poder tener mejores ingresos con las mejoras que haga a su local y de esta manera dar a su hijo una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lelia, 27, lives with her 8 year old son in the Santa Martha cooperative in Santo Domingo, Ecuador. Santo Domingo is the fourth largest city in Ecuador after Guayaquil, Quito and Cuenca. The population of 352,300 is growing quickly because there is a lot of commerce and the biggest cattle market in the country. The province is 3,857 square kilometers and is at an altitude of 624 meters above sea level. The average temperature is 24.4 degrees Celsius and sometimes it reaches 38 C. The entire province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas is part of the mountainous coastal area, in the western range. It is historically known as the Province of Yumbos [an indigenous group] and the Hummingbird Capital. It is located in the humid tropics of Latin America. This is considered a new province, as it was created in 2007. 

Lelia has had a fast food business for some years. She says she learned from some friends. She is a client of Fundacion Alternativa, who helps her with business loans. Today she wants to invest in improvements to her restaurant. Fundacion Alternativa provides not just financial services, but also advising and trainings. Lelia attends the trainings because the topics are interesting to her.

Her dream is to make more money and she hopes the improvements will help with that. She wants to give her son a good education and better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her fast food business.

loans.name: Nazil

texts.en: Nazil is a thirty-five-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a car.  He has been a farmer for the last six years.  His major hardships are price fluctuations and seasonal weather.  He has a vision of expanding his farm and starting up a dairy.  Nazil needs this loan to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy two cows for rearing.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is 30 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been in the retail shop business for the last two years, from which she earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Linah was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her third loan of 25,000 KES, after having repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to buy assorted goods for selling, including bags of flour, rice, and tea leaves.

Linah hopes to use the additional profit created to restock more goods for sale and buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy assorted goods for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Reaksmey

texts.en: Reaksmey, 23, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over two years. Her husband is a sculptor. In order to improve her family finances, Reaksmey is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice in the dry season to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a groceries store at home.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Reyna Inés

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con la confección de muñecas de trapo años atrás y le ha resultado una actividad muy productiva hasta ahora.  Además se dedica a la venta de muebles y repisas.  Trabaja sola, todos los días realizando sus manualidades.  No es casada pero tiene hijos, quienes ya son todos adultos.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de muebles e insumos necesarios para la manufactura de sus productos.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad.  She started making rag dolls years ago and it has resulted in a very productive business that she manages to this day.  In addition, she sells furniture and shelving.  The borrower works alone every day, engaging in her handicrafts.  She is not married, but she has children who are all adults.  

For now, the borrower needs this loan so that she can buy furniture to sell and necessary supplies for making her products.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making rag dolls and furniture to sell.

loans.name: Mirlene

texts.fr: Mirlene, âgée de  40 ans, est divorcée  et mère d’un enfant. Elle vend des vêtements au centre ville. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus pour prendre soin de son foyer. Avec les crédits elle beaucoup développé son activité. Elle continue à chercher de l’appui financier pour développer davantage son commerce afin d’augmenter ses revenus et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en: Mirlene is 40-year-old divorced mother to one child. She earns a living through selling clothing in the city centre. This activity brings in enough revenue to maintain her household. Thanks to these loans, she has been able to greatly develop her enterprise. She continues to seek finance support in order to further develop her business so that she can increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Santos De Jesus

texts.es: Don Santos de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas desde hace mas de 30 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto adicional en el lugar que muestra en la fotografia pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de todos los materiales de contruccion necesarios para poder tener una vivienda mas amplia y comoda.

loans.use: para la compra de todos los materiales de contruccion necesarios

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lydia would like to buy Dairy Cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for his carpentry business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Catherine was born in 1950 in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of five (05) children. She never went to school, because of a lack of resources and doesn't want her children to suffer the same fate. It is for this reason that she quickly started a business selling raw ingredients like tomatoes, onions and other things. Very serious and dynamic, she was able to manage her first loan and has repaid it. She is now asking for a new loan of $800 to build up her business so she can improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Catherine est née en 1950 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, n’ayant pas été à l’école par manque de moyens, elle ne voulait pas faire subir le même sors à ses enfants. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est vite lancé dans le commerce des produits de premières nécessités (tels que la tomate, l’oignon et autres). Très sérieuse et dynamique, elle a su bien gérer son premier crédit obtenu et a bien remboursé. Ainsi, elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit de $800 pour renforcer son commerce afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling raw ingredients

loans.name: Comlan

texts.fr:
Comlan K. was born on February 5, 1974 in Agbanakin (Lacs prefecture). He is a teacher, and he is married and the father of a child. In addition, he is the guardian of four orphans. As a member of an Advance Technology Program non-governmental organization fighting against child trafficking, Mr. K. is leading a fierce struggle to ensure that the basic needs of all his dependents are met. He has a shop where he sells groceries, dry goods, and services such as word processing and photocopying. His wife helps him manage the shop. In face of an ever-pressing demand, especially for new items, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to supply his shop and to improve his business performance.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Comlan est né le 05 Février 1974 à Agbanakin (P/Lacs). Marié et père d’un enfant, il a à sa charge quatre (4) autres enfants orphelins de père et de mère. Membre d’un ONG ATP combattant la lutte contre le trafic des enfants, Monsieur K. Comlan mène une lutte acharnée pour assurer le minimum de ces enfants à sa charge. Enseignant, il dispose d’une boutique d’alimentation générale, de mercerie et des travaux de traitement de texte, photocopieur qu’il gère avec l’aide de sa femme. Face à une demande de plus en plus pressante surtout en nouveaux produits. Monsieur K. Comlan sollicite un montant de $1000 pour l’approvisionnement de la boutique et l’amélioration de ses prestations.

loans.use: To supply her shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother of one child.  She was abandoned by her husband due to a marital misunderstanding.  Presently, she feeds herself and her family from the small income she gets from her knitting business.  However, she also has the responsibility of providing for her relatives.

With a loan of $100, she plans to increase her knitting business and sell her sweaters in schools and nurseries.  She also plans to fabricate and sell yogurt to local primary school pupils.

The profit will be used to provide basic needs for her family and pay school fees for her daughter who is in secondary school.

loans.use: Invest in and expand her knitting business

loans.name: Ni Luh Gede Wirawati

texts.id:
Although a wife of public official, Wirawati did not want to stay at home only, while taking care of her child of 2 years Wirawati raised 1 mother pig. After 6 months the pig bore 6 piglets and 2 months later the piglets sold for Rp. 250.000 (USD25), - each. Cost of feed required of Rp. 10.000 (USD1) daily. Temporary, the mother pig is leased beneath a tree while Wirawati renovated the pen, because formerly the pen was made of bamboo, now permanent so that it is easier to clean. This loan from Dinari will be used to purchase 5 piglets for growth and the balance for feed/supplies. The income will be used for her child’s education, currently in SD (elementary school).

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang karyawan swasta, tapi Wirawati tak mau tinggal diam dirumah saja, sambil mengasuh anaknya yang masih balita umur 2 tahun Wirawati memelihara babi dibelakang rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Wirawati membeli 1 ekor induk babi. Setelah 6 bulan dipelihara babinya mempunyai anak sebanyak 6 ekor dan 2 bulan anak babinya sudah siap dijual dengan harga Rp.250.000,-per ekor. Biaya pakan yang diperlukan Rp. 10.000,- perhari. Untuk sementara waktu, babinya diikat dibawah pohon karena Wirawati sedang merenovasi kandangnya supaya bagus, karena dulu kandangnya bambu, sekarang sudah permanen agar mudah membersihkannya. Pinjaman dari Dinari ini akan dipakai untuk membeli 5 ekor anak babi untuk penggemukan dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang masih duduk dibangku SD.

loans.use: Purchase five mother pig and feed (Membeli lima ekor bibit babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Mutia

texts.en: Mutia is a 55-year-old married mother of 5 kids. Two of her children have moved overseas but the rest are still in Samoa. Mutia used to regularly rely on remittances from her overseas children until she joined the Program last year. Since then, she has started a taro plantation and started making her own money from selling taro to the market and fellow villagers.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Taro Plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise for her store and also in books

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba sells wood and construction materials, like cement, in the Tandika market. She sells it mainly to carpenters and those in the construction business. She orders her wood from the southern highlands of Tanzania. She is in need of  a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her construction business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix up one of his business locations

loans.name: Tagoymurod

texts.ru:
Togoymurod K. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. He is in the business of raising cattle. He purchases young calves, raises them and sells them on the market at a profit. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. Currently, he wishes to increase the turnover of his business and would like to obtain a loan for this purpose. He plans to repay the loan within a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Камолов Тагоймурод проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 32 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей.Образования не имеет , поэтому занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых телят , откармливает и продает на тех же рынках. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже пять лет.Сейчас клиенту необходимо увеличить товарооборот.Поэтому Тагоймурод обратился к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase young cattle

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun Y., 51, and her husband have been married for over thirty years. They have four children. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Their youngest daughter is a silk weaver. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a silk weaver since she was young. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Now, Mrs. Saroeun is requesting a loan of $250 to finish her daughter’s house (she is shown in the photo with her). Her daughter, Mrs. Sreykhouch Ty, is in the process of building a house in front of her parents’ house. Sreykhouch is a silk weaver and her husband is a village doctor.

loans.use: To finish her daughter’s house

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is 58 years old and the mother of two small children. Out of her home, Esther prepares and sells meals to the locals. Her home is in a very well trafficked region of the city.

Esther’s customers have provided her with a certain level of fame, and every day more and more people pass by to visit her small restaurant. Esther has decided to settle expand her location to better receive her clients and to provide them with a comfortable space.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Esther de 58 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños niños y se dedica a preparar y a comercializar platillos típicos de su región en una zona muy concurrida de su localidad. Sus visitantes le han dado fama y día a día más personas concurren a visitarla por ese motivo desea implementar su espacio de labor a fin de recibir a sus clientes en un espacio adecuado y con mayores comodidades.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Born in Gamé Séva in 1977, Mr. Yaovi A. left school early in life to become a farmer so he could make ends meet. Married with two children, he is a strong, hardworking man who is expert at farming corn. He is requesting a loan so he can increase the size of his corn field, which will provide him with more revenue thus allowing him to effectively meet his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Gamé Séva en 1977, Monsieur A.. Yaovi a très tôt abandonné ses études pour se lancer dans l’agriculture afin de mieux subvenir à ses besoins. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, c’est un homme valide, travailleur qui maîtrise bien la culture du maïs. Pour agrandir son champ, il sollicite un crédit qui va l’aider à augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour renforcer son revenu dans le but de subvenir efficacement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To increase the size of his corn field

loans.name: Dieyla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dieyla N. earns a living selling vegetables with a quick turnover of stock. To satisfy a strong demand for her products, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Dieyla N. exploite un commerce de legumes avec une forte rotation de stock . Pour satisfaire une forte demande , elle sollicite un credit pour renforcer son stock

loans.use: Increase of stock

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Julia es una amorosa ama de casa y gran colaboradora en el taller de carpintería de su esposo Alfredo, ambos se esfuerzan y ponen lo mejor de sí para que cada uno de los trabajos que realizan  quede   del agrado de su exigente clientela.Esta pareja inicia su labor cotidiana a las 7:00 de la mañana y termina a las 6:00 de la tarde, fabrican muebles bajo pedido, elaborando para  proveer a diferentes mueblerías de su ciudad, Juliaca, gracias a este oficio están logrando afrontar satisfactoriamente todos sus gastos familiares.En esta oportunidad, debido a la gran cantidad de solicitudes, requieren obtener variedad de madera  y barniz, con el cual le dan el acabado final a cada una de las piezas que elaboran, por esa razón, Julia presenta esta solicitud de préstamos, dinero que lo invertirán en adquirir materiales de trabajo para seguir elaborando sus muebles.
texts.en:
Julia is a loving housewife and great assistant to Alfredo, her husband, in his carpenter's shop. Both Alfredo and Julia expend all of their energy to insure that each of their projects fully meet the desires of their demanding clientele. The pair begins their labors each day at 7:00 AM and end the day at 6:00 PM. They build and finish furniture by direct order and to stock local furniture dealers in the city. Thanks to their business the pair is fully capable of covering household expenses. Alfredo and Julia have recently received a large quantity of orders, which will require various types of wood and varnish in order to complete. Julia is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase the necessary materials for the preparation and completion of the existing orders.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, varnish and other finishing products.

loans.name: Fotemogoban (La Grandeur Humaine Dépasse Tous Les Qualificatifs) Group

texts.fr:
Composé de (5) femmes toutes mariées, les membres du groupe Fotemogoban  ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Banconi de Sikasso (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Liées par des relations de voisinage et de parenté, elles mènent des activités d’achat et de vente de bois de chauffe, de pâte d’arachide et de condiments alimentaires.
Le groupe est à son 6ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 sacs d’arachide, 18 chargements de charette en bois de chauffe et un stock important de condiments alimentaires tels les aubergines, les chalottes, les épices etc. 
Elles grillent l’arachide pour ensuite les amener au moulin pour en faire des pâtes d’arachide. Elles se ravitaillent généralement auprès des paysans producteurs qui fréquentent le marché hebdomadaire de Sikasso. Elles vendent en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché journalier de leur quartier. La clientèle est constituée essentiellement de femmes (ménagères, restauratrices etc.).       
Elles espèrent  réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 17.500FCFA par mois qu’elles envisagent utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.Dans l’avenir , elles ambitionnent ouvrir une boutique afin de faire le grosssiste dans la vente de la pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
The group Fotemogoban is composed of (5) women all married, who have an average age of 40, and on average 3 children. They live in large traditional extended families in the neighborhood of Banconi in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

United by ties of neighborhood and kinship, they run activities related to the purchase and sale of firewood, peanut butter, and condiments.

The group is on their sixth solidarity loan (group loan). All the previous loans have been fully reimbursed. With this loan they hope to buy 10 bags of peanuts, 18 cartloads of firewood, and an important stock of condiments such as eggplants, shallots, spices etc.

They roast the peanuts and then take them to the mill to make peanut butter. They usually get their supplies from farmer producers who attend the weekly market of Sikasso. They sell retail for cash and often on credit at the daily market in their neighborhood. The customers are mostly women (homemakers and restaurant owners).

They hope to each make a profit of 17,500 FCFA per month, which they will use to repay their loan and to contribute to the families' daily expenses. In the future their ambition is to open a store in order to be wholesale sellers of peanut butter.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various goods

loans.name: Grace Women’S Group

texts.en: Dezilantah P. is a 43-year-old mother of nine children and the foster parent of her late brother's daughter, all of whom are either currently students or graduates.  Having worked as a tailor for 15 years, Dezilantah is talented at making school uniforms, gomeses (traditional Ugandan dresses), shirts, trousers, and other articles of clothing.  Each week, Dezilantah makes about ten dresses and earns a comfortable wage for each dress or other article.  Although Dezilantah currently rents her small shop from a clothing boutique, she still finds the time to teach orphans to sew so that they, too, will one day be self-sufficient. Every few years, Dezilantah has taken out and successfully repaid a loan.  Recently, she decided that she was ready to open her own shop, and has therefore requested a loan of $2800.

loans.use: To purchase materials and prepare for purchasing shop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys O. is a 56-year-old widow. Her husband died after a prolonged sickness. She has three children. One child has completed senior high school, and the rest are still in school.

She has been sewing for three years. She is highly skilled, and her speciality is designing and sewing classy clothing for women. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes.

She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing materials like linen, thread, and thimbles to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called Omega Group. In this group, members serve as social collateral for one another to access and repay loans.

loans.use: Buy more sewing supplies

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 16 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y ventas de plantas para jardín, son personas antiguas del barrios y todas se ayudan para poder comercializar sus productos.
Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 8 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiada con un crédito promedio de gs. 540.000 cada integrantes.
La señora Beatriz presidenta del comité comenta que el grupo de mujeres están llevando acabo un proyecto que esta teniendo buenos resultados y es la siguiente, llevar a exponer sus productos en la cercanía de la basílica de Caacupé y otro grupo lo están haciendo en la ciudad de San Bernardino los fines de semana, los resultados son muy favorable ya que registraron muy buena venta estas últimas semanas.
Cada una de ellas realiza una actividad comercial específica que les permite aportar al ingreso familiar. Estas actividades son las siguientes:
Beatriz A.               - Vivero                     
Elizabeth B.           -  Despensa              
Reina A.                  -  Vivero                      
Mirecha C.             - Vendedora de ropas     
Sonia G.               - Vivero               
Estela R.          - Despensera                    
Rosita F.               Vivero                                          
Milca B.                 - Despensa                   
Ana B.                 Vivero                                              
Jimena A.     - Despensa                      
Norma A.              Vivero                     
Maria G.               - Vivero                      
Leticia H.          - Venta de ropas                 
Teodolina E.      - Despensa         
Cynthia A.           - Vivero                                
Estela F.             - Vivero 


Con los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya las integrantes compraron gran cantidad de semillas, abonos, mangueras, macetas, otras compraron artículos para la despensa como, azúcar, yerba, leche, carne, galleta.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 hard-working ladies from the Cabañas de Caacupé company. The majority of them are farmers and own plant nurseries, selling plants for home gardens. They know the neighborhoods well and all of them help each other with product sales. Now the group is in its eighth loan cycle of the Hardworking Women committee, and they would benefit from a loan of gs 540,000 for each member. Mrs. Beatriz is the president of the committee, and she notes that this group of women is finishing a project. They are showing their products around the Caacupé basilica and in the city of San Bernardino on the weekends. The results are very favorable, and the ladies have recorded good sales in recent weeks. Each of them works in a specific field and contributes to her household income. These are: Beatriz A. - Hatchery Elizabeth B. - Grocery Reina A. - Nursery Mirecha C. - Clothing Sales Sonia G. - Nursery Estela R. - Grocery Rosita F. - Nursery Milca B. - Grocery Ana B. - Nursery Jimena A. - Grocery Norma A. - Nursery Maria G. - Nursery Leticia H. - Clothing Sales Teodolina E. - Grocery Cynthia A. - Nursery Estela F. - Nursery With loans from Fundación Paraguaya the group members will buy a large quantity of seeds, fertilizer, hoses, and flowerpots. Others will buy supplies for their groceries, such as sugar, tea, milk, meat, and chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, garden plants, and flowerpots. Some ladies will also buy merchandise for their grocery stores, such as sugar, tea, meat, flower, milk, coal, and all types of drinks.

loans.name: Ahmatillo

texts.en:
Since his youth, P. Ahmatillo has been in touch with the countryside. His family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables and he imagined he’d be in the business of selling produce. Fortunately, he has realized this dream. At the age of 22, he began to sell fruit and vegetables in small markets. Little by little, he saved money so he could set up his own shop. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this business, Ahmatillo’s enterprise has been growing gradually. Nevertheless, Ahmatillo believes it is time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at the wholesale level and obtain better prices. As a result, he is applying for a loan of 3500 Somoni, which he will repay in 9 months. With your help, Ahmatillo will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and two children a better future. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase the range of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng Y. is 36 years old, pictured here with her husband and little child, and has a business raising ducks for eggs to sell in the market. Every day, her husband transports duck eggs to sell at the market. On average, this couple earns a combined income of around US$ 5 per day. Mrs. Cheng Y. is asking for a loan to purchase a trailer for her husband to transport their duck eggs; any remainder will be used to purchase feed for the ducks.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport their eggs to market

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng S. is a 51 year-old widow with a 24 year-old daughter. They live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Loeng has been selling fruit and sugar cane juice since 2000. She buys many kinds of fruits, such as mangoes and sapodillas, from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in the village market. Loeng sells vegetable and grocery items as well. She is requesting a loan of $600 to expand her business by purchasing rice for resale and repairing her sugar cane juicing machine.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale and repair her sugar cane juicing machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ebun

texts.en: Ebun is 46 years old and is married with three children. She sells shoes, gift and kitchen items such as pots, iron, microwave, etc. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more shoes, gift and kitchen items to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, gift and kitchen items to sell

loans.name: Buore

texts.en:
Buore is a 29 year old mother of two children, ages 7 and 4 and a half. She sells mandazi (a donut-like pastry), vegetables, and tomatoes in the Manyatta slum in Kisumu. She buys from the Jubilee market in Kisumu and sometimes from Kibuye, Kisumu's largest open-air market. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to add more stock to her growing business.

Buore recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutri Flour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy more mandazi ingredients, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Abdusalloh

texts.ru: Манонов Абдусаллох проживает в Варзобском районе. Работает  учителем в средней школе. В 2008 году был выбран лучшим учителем года. Кроме того занимается сельским хозяйством и разведением крупно рогатого скота. Покупает молодых телян для откормки. После откормки продает на рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Хочет купить двух молодых телят. Абдусаллох женат и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Abdusalloh M. lives in the Varzob region. He works as a school teacher and in 2008 was honored as the best teacher of the year. To supplement his salary he also raises vegetables and cattle. Abdusalloh purchases calves for fattening and sells them at the meat market once they are fully grown. He would like to take out this loan to enlarge his herd by buying two additional calves. Abdusalloh is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two calfes

loans.name: Chansihoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chansihoeun N., 48, and her husband, Mr. Heang Pech, 54, were married in 1984 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home; another one is in grade 9 and the youngest son stays at home. Besides her children, she also has an aged mother who is living with her. The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chansihoeun has been selling vegetables and fish phork for over thirty years (fish phork is made of chopped fish, salt, sugar, yeast and rice, placed in large airtight jars and allowed to ferment). She buys fish from a fisherman to make phork at her house and sells it in her village and nearby villages. Her husband assists his wife in the business.

Chansihoeun hopes to purchase more vegetables and fish to make phork. It would be better for her to increase her income to support her family, but she doesn’t have enough capital. That’s why she is asking for her first loan of $500 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fish to make phork

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
B. Zafar is a 42-year-old farmer who lives with his family, consisting of two children and his wife (pictured). He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Zafar has 6 years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Zafar’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for 800 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Zafar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Memunot

texts.en: Memunot is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells bread and eggs. She is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more loaves of bread and eggs to sell. She says "thank you" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread and eggs

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.es:
Jeanina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Jeanina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijas, Jeanina tiene un multiservicio en su casa, en donde vende artículos de regalos, loceria, cristalería, materiales didácticos para niños, además brinda el servicio de locutorio, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Jeanina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales didácticos.
Los sueños de Jeanina son ampliar su negocio, bautizar a sus hijas y que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Jeanina is a member of the village bank called Buena Suerte (Good Luck). Jeanina is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 daughters.

Jeanina has a multiservice business in her home where she sells gifts, china, glassware, educational materials for children and operates a calling center daily in her home.

Jeanina needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in buying more educational materials. Jeanine's dream is to expand her business, baptize her daughters, and to succeed in general.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying educational materials

loans.name: Dumat-Ol

texts.en:
Dumat-ol E. is from the village of Bongbongon, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 45 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Dumat-ol runs a sari-sari shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dumat-ol has run the shop for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Dumat-ol joined HSPFI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and help finance her shop. She has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 18,000 PHP which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dumat-ol is now requesting her 8th loan, for 21,000 PHP, to further expand the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in her sari-sari shop.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells wine, drinks and juice. She sells both wholesale and retail. Fumilayo is 37, married and has one child. Fumilayo hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more juice, drinks and wine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine, drinks and juice

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon is married with three children. Nine years ago he observed that his neighborhood needed a grocery store, so he started one in order to improve his family's quality of life and offer his children a good education. Komiljon started out selling basic necessities and little by little he has added more variety to his business. Today he offers a wide variety of products. He has grown his business with the help of his wife and children. In order to improve the quality of service and meet the demands of his customers, Komiljon is now requesting a $2000 loan which he will use to purchase merchandise. Please help this family improve their life by contributing to the growth of their business. They are sincerely grateful for your support.   

About Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.  But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's history:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 37 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Omar has owned a grocery store since 2003. He sells candies, raw materials, canned food, cheese etc. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store to increase his stock. This is the first time that Omar has requested a loan.
Omar is special in his work because he owns a large variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Omar’s grocery store is very well located and he is well-known is his region. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening another grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe E. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto.Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Fe is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe sells dried fish in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S., 49, and her husband, Mr. Vin Reach, 48, were married in 1979. They have one son and two daughters. Their daughters weave silk at home and their son is attending school. The family lives on an Island on the Mekong River, about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phalla has been selling grocery items for over four years. She buys these at market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of her house. Her husband is a motor taxi driver.

Phalla is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To continue expanding her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 45 years old. She is divorced and has four children. Currently three of her children are in school.

Dora trades in jewelry and mobile phones. She has been in this business for the past five years. Dora buys her goods from the big shops in the city. She “hawks” (door-to-door selling) with her jewelry from house to house and also treks to nearby markets to sell.

Dora wants to use the loan to buy jewels in bulk so she can trek to other markets and make more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase assorted jewelry and phones.

loans.name: Women Shareholders Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Las mujeres Accionistas” está formado por un grupo D. 9 mujeres dinámicas y perseverantes, la mayoría viven en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, la presidenta Celia López Moreira es madre D. dos hijos menores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida y repuestos. Las socias que forman este Banco Comunal trabajan en diferentes labores como; venta D. pescado, abarrotes, carnes, frutas, golosinas, verduras, bebidas, etc. Este Banco forma parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos/Credi-mujer desD. hace cuatro meses, donD. siempre han demostrado ser unas socias puntuales y colaboradoras. En la actualidad este Banco necesita un crédito D. 3500 soles que será utilizado en los diferentes negocios en las que ellas se desempeñan. Este grupo está agradecido por la confianza que depositaron en ellas, porque gracias a los préstamos ellas pueden utilizar su crédito en los negocios que cada una tiene, D. esta manera ellas pueden progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Accionistas" [Women Shareholders] is a group of 9 dynamic and persevering women. Most of them live in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. Their president, Celia López Moreira, is the mother of two minors and has a business that sells food and spare parts. The partners of this communal bank work in different areas such as the sale of fish, groceries, meat, fruits, sweets, vegetables, drinks, etc. This bank has been a part of the Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER Movement for the past four months, and its members have proven to be punctual and collaborative. Currently this bank needs a loan for 3,500 soles, which will be applied to the different businesses the partners manage. This group is grateful for the trust placed on them. Thanks to the loans they can use their credit in the businesses that each of them owns and in this way they can progress and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the different businesses owned by the members: fish, groceries, meat, fruits, sweet, and drinks.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 6 años, vive en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió primaria incompleta, se dedica a la venta de comida al paso.  En sus tiempos libres se dedica al bordado.

Aurora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar pollo, maíz y aceite para la elaboración de sus comidas.

Su sueño para el futuro es comprar algunos muebles y otros para su comodidad y que su hija sea profesional. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de pago de los préstamos y los ahorros
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurora has been a partner in “La Juleñita” community bank for the past six years. She lives in the Juli district, in the provence of Chucuito near the neighborhood of Puno. She is 43 years hold, lives with her partner and one child. She completed her high school studies. She works selling prepared meals as a street vendor. In her free time, she does embroidery.
