She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Edelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Twezimbe  Women's Group-Buikwe,lugazi

texts.en: Florence N. is a 40-year-old business lady who has operated a restaurant in Lweru-Lugazi for 15 years. It is a business that this buoyant and happily married mother of seven says generates KES80,000 in weekly profits. Florence also does some farming and tailoring on the side. She says diligence is what has gotten her this far in her business and she will use this loan to purchase more food for her restaurant. Florence belongs to Twezimbe Women's group, Lugazi.

loans.use: The purchase of more food for her restaurant

loans.name: 37. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Sinh N. Thị (6) is a 57-year-old female living in the town of Thi Tran Thieu Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Sinh is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 37. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa (12.12.37 Thieu Hoa).
Sinh is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Sinh operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising cattle for sale. Sinh has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2011, Sinh joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her 1st from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Sinh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1.  Lê Thị Thu (14) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2.  N. T. Sơn (13) is a 30-year-old male who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sinh N. Thị (6) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thị Trấn Thiệu Hóa Thanh Hóa.  Sinh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 37 Thị Trấn Thiệu Hóa (12.12.37 Thiệu Hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Sinh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sinh kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Sinh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sinh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Thu (14) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Sơn (13) là 30 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (T. Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Yogui Del Socorro

texts.es: Yogui Del Socorro de 30 años, una mujer trabajadora que inspira en sacar adelante a su familia. Inicio desde hace 11 años,  con su negocio por lo que tenía que buscar cómo salir adelante con sus dos hijos menores de edad que estaban a su cargo. En la actualidad el empieza su trabajo desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, por lo que tiene que salir todos los días a vender sus productos como calzado, sabanas, toallas, ropa en general, cosméticos, tratamientos y calzado. Tiene ciertas dificultades ya que tiene que cuidar a sus dos hijos menores de edad y realizar  los quehaceres domésticos su credito lo solicita para la compra de calzado, sabanas, toallas, ropa en general, cosméticos, tratamientos y calzado. En un futuro lo que más quiere es ampliar su negocio y así mejorar su condición económica y darle lo mejor a familia en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Yogui Del Socorro is 30 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who wishes to get her family ahead in life.  She started her business 11 years ago because she had to find a way to get ahead with her two young children who were in her care.  Yogui currently starts work at 8.00am and works until 9.00pm.  She has to go out every day to sell her products which include footwear, sheets, towels, clothes, cosmetics and treatments.  It is a little difficult for Yogui because she has to look after her two young children and also do her housework.

Yogui is requesting this loan to buy footwear, sheets, towels, clothes, cosmetics and treatments.  What she would most like in the future is to expand her business so that she can improve her financial position and provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy footwear, sheets, towels, clothes, cosmetics and treatments

loans.name: Winner Plus Group

texts.en:
Auguy is the chairman of a Community Bank named “Winner Plus” which is composed of 12 members.  These entrepreneurs are united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Auguy is 39 years old and single.  He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2005.  He runs a cellphone booth and has a money changer business in the southwest of Kinshasa. He works hard to gain good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his area. His business brings in $105 per week. 

Auguy is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having received and successfully repaid four previous loans. With this new loan, he will increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing phone accessories to resell at a profit. Auguy is very happy to be part of Hope’s groups because it will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: increase his inventory of phone accessories

loans.name: Bertilla Lucrecia

texts.es:
Bertilla de 44 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona peri-urbana, con montañas y caminos de tierra).ella es separada pero después se unió a su actual pareja tienen 2 hijos. Se dedica a ala venta de comida.

Comenzó su actividad hace varios años ella labora diariamente con ayuda de su conyugue. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas, sillas demás artículos para su negocio. en un futuro desea comprar una casa que le están vendiendo la garante para dejarle de alquilar.
texts.en:
Bertilla is 44 years old, she lives in a neighborhood of Guayaquil called Fortin (a suburban area characterized by its dirt roads and mountains). After she separated from her husband, she went living with her current partner, and they have 2 children. She engages in selling meals.

She started her activity many years ago. She works every day with her partner’s help. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tables, chairs and other items for her shop. In the future she wants to buy a house that the owner is offering her for sale, so that she will no longer have to rent.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy RTW products like pants, blouses, etc. to sell in her stall.

Delia has been in this business for 29 years.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy RTW products like pants, blouses, etc. to sell in her stall

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to children at a nearby school. Her major challenge is seasonality in the business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future. 

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat for her food stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Womens Group

texts.en: 2 years is the amount of time 34 year old Mohammed has been operating his shoe sales business in Kayunga. The father of 5 says he began this enterprise with savings from his farming business. As for the future, he is hoping he can use his diligence to make substantial progress. He says this business can generate as much as 180,000 shillings in sales revenue each month. With this loan, Mohammed says he is going to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maricela; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de carne de res, ella lleva a diferentes tipos de ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta como la feria de Inquilpata y tiene un puesto en el mercado de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carne. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Maricela, a member of “RICHARY ANTEÑA”, a Communal Bank located in Anta, a district of the Anta province, in the Cusco department.

Maricela is 45 years old, she is married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity: she buys and sells beef. She works in the different fairs of the Anta province, such as the Inquilpata fair, and she also has a stall in the Anta market. She wants to increase her meat selling activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy meat at wholesale price.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy meat at wholesale price.

loans.name: Bwanika Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 40-year-old married man with twelve children all living in a residential house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family.

Joseph operates a boutique and has been in business for ten years now. His major challenges have been ever-increasing rent and price fluctuations.

Joseph is requesting a portion of the loan in his group of twelve in order to buy more clothes to sell. His desire is to build his own business premises and to educate his children up to university.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo has been working as a farmer in the Philippines for four years. He hopes to increase his earnings from his business to uplift his family from their poor living conditions. 

He is now 33 years old and married with three young children. In farming, Domingo is earning PHP 20,000 every harvest season during the months of April and November, yearly. His income always goes to his family needs and the allowances of his children in school. 

He hopes to borrow PHP 10,000 to use as added capital to buy fertilizers and hybrid rice seed to maintain his farm. To ensure his family's economic stability, Domingo is doing his best to improve the production of his crop yearly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hybrid rice seed

loans.name: Clive Road Women's Group A

texts.en:
Most budding and fledgling entrepreneurs in Uganda have gone through the mill and did get apprentice business training. That statement should be taken with a grain of salt. It may be a little farfetched, but one can’t rule out the fact that indeed some entrepreneurs did get some business training.

A study carried out recently showed how some business people are nodding acquaintances when it comes to efficiently operating businesses. That proficiency is lacking, but still most businesses, however petty they are, are making headway. This has puzzled most business experts, but it is the status quo that we are all bearing witness to.

If the above, particularly the part that talks about the fact that most people lack business training, is referenced to 42-year-old Kate, an assiduous clothes sales business entrepreneur plying her trade in Jinja, it could hold water. It’s now 15 grueling and chequered years in this business for Kate, who at her age has no kids yet.

She says being devoid of business skills has not played havoc with any of her operations, though she says if she had got the training, she probably would be operating her business in a more worthwhile and proficient way.

Her maiden business was a retail shop and Kate says she utilized her savings to set forth in her cloth sales trade. However, she has not dispensed with her retail shop. She still operates it, though she has delegated the responsibilities of running it to her sister.

She says this business's monthly sales income totals up to 150,000 Ugandan shillings. This is the fourth time Kate's group is taking a loan from Pearl microfinance and their track record in repayments has been good.

Kate says she reckons that with this Kiva loan she will purchase more clothes, principally men's clothes, to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, principally men's clothes, to resell

loans.name: Mahudjro-Ac2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO-AC2 est composé de trois personnes qui mènent des activités communes. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Emilienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emilienne est âgée de 32 ans et vit au  Bénin. Emilienne est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Jean. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Emilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Emilienne vend des produits cosmétiques. Emilienne s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Emilienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO-AC2, un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MAHUDJRO-AC2 is composed of three persons who have businesses in common. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Emilienne, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a welder by the name of Jean. They have two children, who are both in school and in their care. Emilienne lives with together with her husband and children. 

To support herself and her children, Emilienne sells cosmetics. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Emilienne and the other members of the group MAHUDJRO-AC2 are requesting a second loan. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, es empleado de un juzgado, vive con su esposa y un hijo, posee casa propia, tiene 12 años de trabajar y a parte de este también realiza labores agrícolas, por el momento necesita comprar insumos agrícolas para cuidar el cultivo, por ejemplo abono y herbicidas, que le ayudan para fortalecer la planta y prevenirla de plagas.
Esta será una gran ayuda para él, espera tener una producción sana y apoyar a su familia en todo lo posible, además de administrar bien este préstamo por ser el primero.
texts.en:
Pedro works as a court employee.  He lives with his wife and son in his own home.  He has been working in this job for 12 years and also carries out farming work.  Right now, Pedro needs to buy farm supplies with which to care for his crops such as manure and herbicides.  This will help him to strengthen his crops and prevent pests.

This loan represents a great help for Pedro.  He hopes to achieve a healthy production and support his family in so far as he can.  He also hopes to manage this loan well as it is his first.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides for his crops

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Doña Sara tiene un negocio de productos para uso personal, ella tiene 23 años, está casada con el señor Gregorio desde hace 3 años quien trabaja en el campo, hijos aun  no tienen.
 La señora Sara tiene un negocio que por el momento le hace falta mercancía nueva y llenarla para que sea atractiva para sus clientes, ella esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar ropa interior, artículos de belleza como (aretes, maquillaje, cortaúñas, espejos).
En esta actividad lleva tres años su puesto es ambulante ya que con un local  estable aun no cuenta, sin embargo tener un lugar fijo es una de sus metas llegar a poner un local donde también pieza poner un apartado donde venda zapatos.”Gracias por la confianza y el apoyo que me otorgan al prestarme el dinero.
texts.en:
Doña Sara has a business selling personal products.  She is 23 years old, and has been married for the last three years to Señor Gregorio, who works in the fields.  They don't have children as of yet.

Señora Sara has a business that right now needs new merchandise and to stock up so as to attract customers.  On this occasion, she is requesting  a loan to buy underwear and beauty articles such as earrings, makeup, nail-clippers and mirrors.

She has been doing this for three years.  She sells as a street vendor, as she doesn't have reliable premises.  Nevertheless, having a fixed location is one of her goals.  She would like to have premises where she can also dedicate a section to selling shoes.

She says, "Thank you for the trust and the support that you are providing me by lending me this money".

loans.use: to buy underwear, costume jewelry, nail-clippers, earrings, necklaces, bracelets, hairclips, brushes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is widowed with  two grown children. She is 49 years old and lives in Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she operates a food stall along the street on which many people are passing by. The more crowded the place, the higher is the possibility of sales. She sells checheria, food snacks, candies, fruit salads, and more. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns a total of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase additional products to sell.

Cecilia has been a member of GDMPC for four years. She took out several loans from the cooperative and was able to reimburse them promptly. In the future, Cecilia hopes to have a vehicle as another means of income and for extra undertakings when necessary. She further plans to expand and improve the business for more gain.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es:
Jose Amadeo tiene 54 años, es viudo y tiene 6 hijos.

Jose Amadeo trabaja como agricultor desde los 12 años. Este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, y con dicha profesión ha conseguido sostener a sus hijos; incluso después de haber quedado viudo hace más de 10 años.

Jose Amadeo solicita un préstamo de Fundación Campo para comprar abono, pesticidas, y otros insumos para su cosecha. Con dichos insumos Jose Amadeo podrá cosechar un buen producto para luego comercializarlo. Su cosecha actualmente está en muy buen estado dada la abundante lluvia durante esta temporada.

En un futuro Jose Amadeo planea mejorar el techo de su casa y construir otra habitación para que sus hijos puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Jose Amadeo is 54 years old.  He is a widower, and has six children.

Jose Amadeo has been working as a farmer for the last 12 years.  He learned this trade from his father, and through his profession he has been able to provide for his children, even after becoming a widower over 10 years ago.

Jose Amadeo is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy manure, pesticides and other supplies for his crops.  With these supplies, Jose Amadeo will be able to harvest a good crop for subsequent sale.  His current crop is in very good shape thanks to the abundant rain they've had this season.

In the future, Jose Amadeo plans to improve his home's roof and build another room so that his children can live better.

loans.use: to buy manure and other supplies for his corn crop.

loans.name: Aapasara

texts.en:
Aapasara is 28 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged four.  In 2000, she established her cow-raising business.  She supports her family by working seven days per week and four hours per day. 

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Aapasara plans to lift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung, which is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and for methane production.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Maria Mercedes se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos hace 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ya tiene clientela y muchos clientes ya realizan sus pedidos, a ciertos clientes les deja sus productos al contado como también a crédito, es muy buena cliente, trabajadora y muy responsable. Con el dinero del crédito comprara platos, vasos, baldes, cubiertos desechables y bolsas de todos los tamaños.  La señora se encuentra agradecida por la confianza y el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Maria Mercedes has sold plastic items for 14 years. She has a customer base and many customers make orders. She sells to some customers on credit, but others pay in cash. Maria is a very good client; she is very hard-working and responsible. With the money from this loan, she will buy plates, glasses, buckets, disposable cutlery, and bags of all sizes. She is very grateful for your support and confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, buckets, disposable cutlery and bags of all sizes.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is  32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. He is the main income provider of his family. He has been working as car blacksmith since 2007. His shop is situated in his town. 

Ali is requesting a loan for $1,200 from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase metA. products needed for his work. He has high hopes for the future of his business and he is certain that the loan will noticeably improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase metal products needed for his work

loans.name: Kopiya Farmers Group

texts.en:
Peter is the facilitator of the Kopiya Farmers Group, Peter and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Peter was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Peter will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kopiya Farmers Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Peter is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nicolosa

texts.es:
Nicolasa de 46 años es una mujer separada. Vive con 2 de sus 5 hijos a los que cuida y cría como una buena madre. Esta familia vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Tarma. Nicolasa es una madre abnegada, todo el esfuerzo que despliega lo hace para darles a sus hijos lo mejor y lo que está a su alcance.
Con esa convicción Nicolasa se dedica a la venta de dulces, manjar blanco, quesos, panes, gaseosas, etc., los que expende a los visitantes de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que su puesto de venta se encuentra alrededor del terminal terrestre de ómnibus y autos. 
Para ello, todas las mañanas sube su mercadería encima de un triciclo, de esa manera pede movilizar su producto y agilizar sus ventas.
“La venta es buena, solo se tiene que ser constante en el trabajo nada más. Al día estoy ganando un aproximado de 40 a 50 soles, pero los días de mayor venta son en semana santa, fiestas patrias y navidad, por que la mayor cantidad de viajeros”, explica.
Mas adelante, Nicolasa anhela ampliar su negocio con la instalación de otro punto de venta, pues es consciente de que es rentable. Éste sería su crédito número 2 de MFP, que obtendría gracias a su ayuda, por esa razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Esta contenta con su grupo y banco comunal pues sabe que equipo puede lograr más cosas.
Invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de suministros para su negocio como: jabas de queso, baldes de manjar blanco, gaseosas, aguas minerales, etc.
texts.en:
Nicolasa, 46, is divorced.  She lives with two of her five children who she takes care of like any good mother.  This family lives in a rental house in the city of Tarma.  Nicolasa is a self-sacrificing mother and all of her efforts go toward giving her children the best she can.  With this conviction Nicolasa sells sweets, fudge, cheeses, breads, sodas, etc. to visitors in the city of Tarma.  She has a stall in the bus terminal.  Every morning she loads her merchandise on a tricycle cart which makes it easy to move her products and facilitate sales.

"Sales are good if one works consistently.  I earn about 40 or 50 PEN per day, but the best days are during Easter, national holidays and Christmas, because of all the visitors.", she explains.  In the future, Nicolasa wants to expand her business and set up another sales point because she knows it is profitable.  

This is her second loan through MFP thanks to your support, and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She is happy with her communal bank group because she knows that through teamwork she can achieve more.

She plans to use the loan to buy supplies for her business such as crates for cheese, trays of fudge, sodas and mineral water.

loans.use: To buy crates to store cheese, trays for fudge, sodas and mineral water.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид 39 - летний мужчина проживающий в районе Шахритус. Он женат. Он является отцом четверых детей. Абдурашид занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Abdurashid is a 39 year-old man, living in the Shahrituz district.  He is married and is a father of four children.  Abdurashid is involved in agriculture.  He grows vegetables for sale.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  Abdurashid is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin is 31-year-old a married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a business selling food from a stall in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Madelin is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cassava and onions. If she is able to make any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to use the money to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and onion

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a widow with two children. She is 49 years old, residing in Calabayan Ozamis City. 

Lourdes owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se dedica al pequeño negocio de venta de ropa. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. El crédito que requiere Juana es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo blusas, camisas, casacas y otras cosas más.
  
El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo blusas, camisas, casacas y otras cosas más.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 41 years of age. She has dedicated her body and soul to her farming business and to her husband. 

Prisca has been characterized by her neighbours and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began ten years ago. 

Prisca is tired of working just to survive and wishes to request a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Prisca’s family, and a commodity for trade. 

Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers, like Prisca, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.

loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting and for feeding her family.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga. She has a retail business selling animal feed.

Nga is 24 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents

This is Nga first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Nga has been involved in this business for 6 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water syterm and hygeinic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bath-room and water filter systerm .

In the future, Nga hopes for her business to do well, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: Xây mới nhà vệ sinh tự hoại

loans.name: Alma Patricia

texts.en:
Alma lives in the city of Queretaro. Ten years ago she started selling cosmetics, as a very enterprising person, to contribute to the well being of her family and their quality of life. Given her great dedication and persistence in sales and the direction of her sales people, in a short time she was made manager. She has demonstrated that she is a very responsible and able person and she can conquer any goal becasue she is motivated by the love of her family.

Today she needs a loan of $475 that she will use toward the purchase of merchandise and to increase her sales and improve her income. You can contribute to Alma's development. Do not wait any longer and help her maintain what she has built with so much effort. She and her family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma vive en la localidad de Querétaro, ella hace 10 años comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, pues es una persona muy emprendedora y ha luchado poder contribuir al bienestar y calidad de vida de su familia. Debido a su gran dedicación y empeño de las ventas y dirección de sus vendedoras, en un lapso corto de tiempo se convirtió en directora. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y capaz de llevar a cabo cualquier meta propuesta siempre impulsada por el amor a su familia.}

En este momento ella necesita de un crédito de $ 475 DLLS mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, poder aumentar su nivel de ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de Alma, no lo dudes más y ayúdala a sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha logrado construir. Ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purcahse mercahndise

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh is an Internally Displace Person from the Armenian-occupied Khojavand region of Azerbaijan. When his family was relocated, he was a boy. Now he is 19 years old. His family faced many hardships. Now Taleh wants to contribute to the family income. He rented a room where he has only one TV and game device. Many children come to play games. Now he wants to buy two more computers to attract more people to his game cafe and also provide Internet services. This is his first loan and he wants $300.

loans.use: To buy two computers

loans.name: Erika Janeth

texts.es:
Erika and her husband have had their convenience store for one year. "I run the business out of my home, and we depend on it. We would like to enlarge the store and add more supplies. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to do this, which well help us increase our profits and provide for our family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra.Erika y su esposo tiene su negocio desde hace 1año." El negocio lo tengo en mi casa son de las viviendas económicas y estamos muy reducidos por el negocio, nos gustaría ampliar el negocio y surtirlo de mercancía. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para Ampliar y surtir el negocio y tener mas ventas ya que es el sustento de la familia.

loans.use: Enlarge and stock convenience store

loans.name: Zoumavo

texts.fr:
Born in Agomé-Glozou in 1951, Mrs. Y. Zoumavo is married and the mother of six children. In addition to her children, she also responsible for supporting six other people as well. Preparing grocery products is her daily activity. She's known by everyone for her warm welcome, her smile, and her open-mindedness. Over 20 years in business have made her an expert in her trade. In prosperous times she stocks beans in bags and buys oil that she stores in drums and wood in order to sell them later for a better price when they are in short supply on the market. Today she is seeking a $600 loan to finance this activity. The earnings from her sales will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Agomé-Glozou en 1951, Madame Y. Zoumavo est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Outre ces derniers, elle a à sa charge six (6) autres personnes. La préparation des denrées est son activité quotidienne. Connue de tous pour son accueil, son sourire et son ouverture. Plus de 20 ans d’activité déjà, lui confère une maîtrise parfaite de son activité. Pendant les périodes d’abondance, elle achète du haricot qu’elle stock en sacs, de l’huile qu’elle met en bidons et du bois afin de s’attendre à une bonne vente en temps de pénurie. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir faire tout cela. Les bénéfices de la vente lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Stocking of beans and oil

loans.name: Margarita Encarnació

texts.en: Margarita, 20, is one of the few young people in her community to cultivate the entrepreneurial spirit. She is also very responsible. She got married last year to another young man of 25. Four years ago, she started her business selling clothes, hair products and skin care products. Her store is well known by people of the township and she has an established clientele. The loan requested is to buy hair gel, since this has been in short supply. Margarita uses a part of her income to help her mother, who sometimes helps her attend to the business.

loans.use: To purchase more hair gel for her business

loans.name: Subgroup A Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
MOSES, age 49, is married and has 6 kids (ages 21, 19, 16, 12, 9, and 6). He owns a family-run coffee shop where he sells breakfast foods and snacks in the evening. He originally opened this business in 1974. The shop was temporarily closed for 18 years, however, while he served a local government position. It was re-opened in 2000. His business now makes a profit of around $5.50 a day, which he uses to pay house expenses and school fees. He attends to about 40 customers in the morning and 60 in the evening at his shop.

Moses is the leader of Subgroup A of Group Sungura (Swahili for “Rabbit”), which totals 31 members. He will be sharing this loan with subgroup members: Moi M. (tailoring business), Ester J. (sells soft drinks), Agness Z. (food business), and Ibrahimu M. (sells used clothing). Moses knows each of his subgroup members personally since they all live and work near each other. He and his subgroup have taken 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses and were able to pay them back successfully.

Moses used the previous loans on his business and also to purchase a plot of land. With the new loan, he hopes to open a tailoring business for his son.

loans.use: To open a tailoring business for his son.

loans.name: Noela

texts.en: Noela is a married mother of 45. She has five children, two of them are girls and three are boys. She lives with the boys. The rest are living in New Zealand. She is a very helpful person, which is why her husband works hard. Her husband recognizes the support from his wife, not only for the good of her family but also for her childrens' school funds. She takes 2-3 bags of taro twice a week to the market and she gets $80-120 USD.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Ziver

texts.en: Ziver is a resident of Sumgayit town. She is married and has three children. She has a small shed in her yard and she raises goats and sheep there. She sells milk and meat products. She sells sheep and goats to butchers in the local market. Thus she earns a living for the family. She has a few head of animals and wants to increase the number of her animals. She applies for a loan from Normicro Sumgayit as she has almost no funds of her own. She needs $400 for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Mwanaheri H. , age 30, is married with 3 children (ages 11,7 and 3). She has a table top business which she began 6 months ago. Her business is open from 10am to 9pm daily, making a monthly profit of about US$52.

In the past, Mwanaheri has taken out 3 previuos loans from Tujijenge Tanzanain to start the table top business. She hopes to receive a new loan to increase on the same business. She will share this loan with her sun-group members with businesses of selling fish, shoes, shops and charcoal.

In the picture, Mwanaheri is 1st on the right

loans.use: to increase on capital

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher Ostonokulovich R. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 23 years old and single. Alisher has an incomplete college degree in ecology. He cannot continue his education since college has become very expensive and Alisher was forced to take an academic break. To earn money for his studies Alisher works as a builder for hire. He also raises calves, sheep and goats in a small barn that he owns and sells the animals after fattening them. Since the prices for livestock are currently slightly lower, he wants to buy more sheep and goats. However, Alisher needs additional funding for this purchase and he has decided to take out this loan. This way he will be able to expand his herd and increase the earnings from animal sales. Alisher is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Ризоев Алишер Остонокулович проживает в районе Варзоб. Холост , ему 23 года. Образование неполное высшее. По специальности Эколог. Нет возможности учится , так как обучение стоит дорого и Алишер взял академический отпуск.Для того , чтобы заработать на учебу клиент зарабатывает работая строителем по найму. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник в котором разводит бычков и мелко рогатый скот. А после откормки их продает.Сейчас , когда цены на животных немного ниже клиент хочет купить овец и коз. Но для этого клиенту нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил получить кредит. Таким путем , он сможет увеличить поголовье скота, что даст возможность увеличить доход от продаваемых животных. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goats and sheep

loans.name: Uchena

texts.en: Uchena O. is 30-years old, married and has 3children.She hails from Okoko Lagos State Nigeria. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. Uchena acquired has been in her business since 2005. Uchena is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is married with three children. Her husband works as a security guard. She started her business to support her husband who was an unemployed mason. Twelve years ago she started her grocery store in a small room in her house which has grown, little by little.

She now asks for a loan of $1,175 that she will repay in six months to buy merchandise and to increase her sales. This way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo que estaba desempleado y era albañil. Comenzó hace doce años con su tienda de abarrotes al principio solo en cuartito de su casa, el cual poco a poco ha ido ampliando.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $1,175 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía e incrementar sus ventas y así tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil B. is 53 years old and earns income running a food store. He lives in the Imishli region and started his business in 1990. Adil is married and has two sons. To improve his business, he would like to purchase a refrigerator and beverages that sell particularly well in the extremely hot summer season in southern Azerbaijan. Therefore, Adil is asking for a loan of US$1,200.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages and a refregerator

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is 33 years old. He is married with two kids who are currently in school. Godwin is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screw drivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Evergreen Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as a social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, chị Hoàng Thị Lãn 40 tuổi đã bước sang năm thứ 6  vay vốn. Nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng và nghề phụ là làm chiếu. Những năm trước khi trưa tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị còn thiếu vốn nên không phát huy được nghề phụ. Được vay vốn chính là cơ hội để gia đình chị phát triển kinh tế, Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn. Từ những dư án chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ gia đình chị dần dần phát triển mô hình chăn nuôi lớn hơn. Sau nhiều năm vay vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi có hiệu quả, gia đình chị đã có số tiền tiết kiệm kha khá chị đã quyết định đầu tư vốn vào nghề phụ sẵn có của gia đình, mua máy móc và các sản phẩm làm chiếu. Hiện tại công việc của gia đình chị rất phát triển. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ
texts.en:
A member of the Fund since 2003, Mrs. Hoàng Thị Lãn is 40 years old and starting her sixth borrowing year. The main source of income of the family is farming, with mat making as side activity. Prior to joining the Fund, her family did not have enough capital to avoid this side activity. The loans provided an opportunity for her family to develop its economy. The family invested the first loan into pig farming, and the activity has expanded. After several years, the investments are producing results. The family manages to generate profit that Mrs. Lãn would like to invest into the family's side activity, by buying a machine and running a mat making business. Currently, the activity of her family is developing well. For this round, her family would like to borrow 9.000.000đ to invest further in pig farming. Its income is 6.000.000đ on average

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer que a pesar de las dificultades viene saliendo adelante, es natural del distrito de Cabanillas, desde que se separó de su esposo, hace más de 6 años, radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, actualmente vive junto a sus 2 menores hijos, en una habitación alquilada.Con el ahorro que disponía decidió comprar un triciclo, golosinas, galletas y bebidas gaseosas, que son vendidas frente al instituto técnico superior de dicha ciudad, hoy se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que va obteniendo, por ello que tiene pensado  aumentar  el volumen y variedad  de productos, por lo que solicita este préstamo, Carmen cree que  haciendo esto mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y por ende la calidad de vida de sus  queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a woman who under the weight of difficulties has come soaring up. She is from the District of Cabanillas, where she separated from her spouse 6 years ago. She lives in the city of Juliaca, where she currently lives with her 2 small children in a room that she rents. With the savings that she had, she decided to buy a tricycle, sweets, cookies, and soft drinks, which she sold in front of the Institute of Superior Technology in the city. Today she feels very satisfied of the results that she has obtained, and because of this she is thinking of increasing the volume and variety of her products. This is why she is asking for this loan. Carmen thinks that doing this will increase her economic income, and improve the quality of life of her darling children.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the quantity and variety of products that Carmen sells

loans.name: Mamazoir

texts.ru: Хазраткулов Мамазоир житель города Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 26 лет , женат и имеет одного ребенка. Кроме своей семьи , живет с родителями , семья очень большая , а кормильцем является только он. Поэтому ему приходится много работать. Имеет точку , где реализует услуги ксерокопии и денежные  переводы за телефоны различных провайдеров. Дело приносит доход, так как точка находится в центре города. Планирует получить кредит и использовать его на приобретение тонеров и бумаги. Это даст возможность сохранить цены на паредлагаемые услуги. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mamazoir H. lives in the city of Kurgan-Tube. He is 26 years old, married and has one child. Aside from his own family Mamazoir also lives with his parents, so his family is very large, but he is currently the sole provider. Mamazoir works a lot to provide for everyone. He owns and manages a copy and cell phone card shop, which has been a profitable business, especially due to the store's central location. Mamazoir would like to take out a loan in order to purchase toner and paper wholesale in advance, allowing him to keep his prices low despite the rising costs on paper. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper and toner

loans.name: Gift Mlaki's Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Gift M., 30 years old and married with three children aged seven, four and one, has a grain milling machine business which he stared three years ago. Working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, he is able to make a monthly profit of about $320.

Gift has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy land upon which he started building a small house, and now hopes for a new loan to continue its construction. Gift will share this loan with his group, Mungu Tubariki, whose 15 members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Gift is the first on the left in the first row.

loans.use: To continue to build his house.

loans.name: Mihriam

texts.es:
Mihriam es artesana y confecciona busitos y chompitas de lana a maquina para niños de dos a cinco años de edad. Dicha mercadería la comercializa por docenas en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto; los fines de semanas trabaja como empleada de limpieza en un local de eventos sociales. De estas dos actividades  provienen los ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella, su domicilio esta ubicada en la Zona 16 de febrero de la Misma Ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (lana) para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene por estas temporadas.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Mihriam.
texts.en:
Mihriam is a craftswoman who produces machine-made woolen jackets and sweaters for children aged between 2 and 5 years. She puts them up for sale by the dozen at the El Alto city fairs; at weekends, she works as a cleaner at a social center. These two jobs provide the income with which she maintains her two dependent children. She lives in the 16 de febrero area of El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy raw materials (wool) in order to meet seasonal demand.

This is Mihriam's first loan with Impro, which she has been approved to receive.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool for business purposes (making children's jackets and sweaters)

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO " LAS ROSAS" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA NATALI Y POR 12 MIEMBROS, ENTRE EL GRUPO EXISTE UN PARENTESCO FAMILIAR ENTRE LA SEÑORA PAULA Y BERNARDA LAS CUALES SON HERMANAS, AMBAS DECLARAN TENER INGRESOS TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES UNA D. LA OTRA. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMO AL SERVICIO D. LIMPIEZA, MENSAJERÍA, TRABAJOS EN CERÁMICA, AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO, A LA COMERCIALIZACIÓN D. LECHE, COMIDA Y COSMÉTICOS, ACTIVIDADES EN LAS CUALES EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA PERO LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO Y SABEN COMO SACAR A FLOTE SUS NEGOCIOS Y SUS TRABAJOS CON TRANQUILIDAD. EN GENERAL EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. SUS INSUMOS Y AL MEJORAMIENTO D. SUS FUENTES D. TRABAJO PARA SER MAS EFICIENTES Y AHORRAR TIEMPO PARA DEDICARSE A SU FAMILIA. LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN ADMINISTRAR LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS CON RESPONSABILIDAD Y CON MIRAS A UN OBJETIVO COMÚN QUE ES EL D. MEJOR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA Y LA D. SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
The Las Rosas group is represented by Natali and 12 other members, two of whom are related: Paula and Bernarda who are sisters. Both say that their incomes are totally independent of one another. The members operate various business such as cleaning services; messaging services; ceramic works; public transportation services; and milk, food and cosmetics sales. All of their businesses face stiff competition but the members are experienced and know how to manage their businesses and work with equanimity. Generally, the loan will be used to buy basic supplies, make the businesses more productive and allow the members to spend the time they save with their families. The members have experience with cooperatives so they know how to responsibly manage the funds allocated to them. Their common objective is to improve their lives and the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations.

loans.name: Jabiri

texts.en: Jabiri A. runs a shop at Kisiwani at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. He is a Tanzanian married man with two school-age children. He purchases business items from the wholesale shop at Kariakoo city market and other cereal  products directly from the farmers. Income from the business is used to meet children's school fees and daily family needs. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more stock for his business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Мамадчонова Гульчехра девушка 20 лет не замужем.Она живёт с родителями.Гульчехра помогает продавать веники на базаре г.Худжанда.Привозит товар её мать.Гульчехра не может получить высшее образование т.к. их семейный доход хватает на прожиточный минимум.Поэтому благодаря своему бизнесу она поддерживает семейные расходы и проживание.Для увеличения оборота Гульчехра хочет получить кредит
texts.en:
Gulchehra M. is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents. She helps sell brooms at a market in Khujand. Her mother delivers the products. Gulchehra is unable to obtain a higher education because her family’s income is only enough for minimal living expenses. Thanks to her business, she can help with the family’s expenses. She wants to use this loan to increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one child. She sells women's clothing and shoes at Ulana market in Pavlograd city. Twelve years ago she quit her job and decided to be self employed. She began her business with just one location selling the clothing. Svetlana was very determined to develop her business. Today she has four locations at the market. This is a family business now and is the only source of income for Svetlana's family.

Svetlana would like to borrow $900 to build another kiosk. She believes that the more locations she has the more chances that people will buy her inventory. Svetlana's goal is to fix her apartment and to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to build another kiosk

loans.name: Sewa

texts.en:
Sewa Mansaray was born in Kabala. He is 47 and married with six children. Sewa is a lorry (truck) driver and has been in this profession for over 20 years now.

Sewa has accessed several loans from Kiva through SMT. With previous loans, Sewa was able to fix his vehicle, which had broken down for over nine months. With this loan, Sewa will buy spare parts to replace the worn-out ones in his vehicle.

loans.use: Buying spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
H. Rahima is 42 years old. She is married and has a son. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in the town of Penjikent. Rahima works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high, because the national dresses of Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item of the dowry of any girl. She is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works. She is very persistent and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 10 years.

Rahima is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she implemented the basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business in order to attain ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Rahima has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur.

However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue to see her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of $800 for 12 months to increase her assorted inventory. With your help, Rahima will be able to make her business succeed and support her son's education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: BALLA D. EST UN MENUISIER METALLIQUE DE PROFESSION QUI EST MARIE ET PERE DE TROIS ENFANTS .IL HABITE AU QUARTIER KAOSSARA DE THIES .IL EST MEMBRE DE LA MUTUELLE DEPUIS DEUX ANS ET CONTRACTE DES PRETS POUR RENFORCER SON ACTIVITE .AVEC CETTE SOMME IL VA RENFORCER SON STOCK DE MATIERES PREMIERES POUR SATISFAIRE SA CLIENTELE.
texts.en:
Balla D. is a trained metal worker, making metal objects. He is married and the father of 3 children. He lives in the Kaossara neighborhood in Thies. He has been a member of the Association for two years and takes out loans to bolster his business. With this sum he is going to add to his stock of raw materials in order to satisfy his clientele's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: replenish his stock of raw materials

loans.name: Letty

texts.en: Letty A. is forty-six years old and married with a grown child who is a Theology graduate. Her husband is a successful farmer who helped her in raising their family. They grow corn on their piece of land. Since she has only the one son, she prefers that he stay with her. She is determined to improve their standard of living. Even though they have their farm she still became involved in her ready-to-wear business. She peddles around her village to her usual customers, selling on both cash and credit terms. Letty is certain that she can save her profits to use for her family's needs and expenses.  Letty is applying for a loan to expand her business, which will include having her own stall so that she will not have to peddle in the village. Letty is optimistic that her plans will be finalized.

loans.use: To buy addtional ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira M. is married and is a Tanzanian small-businessman. He runs a business selling traditional clothes (Khanga and Vitenge) and also secondhand clothes at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam.

He purchases the traditional clothes at Mnazi Mmoja traditional market center and the secondhand clothes from Karume small traders’ market. He buys wholesale and sells retail to his customers. He needs a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Mr. M. Moses is a businessman operating a restaurant called New Lucky Hotel. He serves foods like millet, meat, beans, rice and groundnuts. He is using the loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of food to increase sales. He has been operating the business for seven years. He has two children aged between two and six years respectively; one is in primary one while the young one is still at home. He aspires to own a large hotel and hopes to increase the variety of foods served.

loans.use: To purchase more food for his restaurant

loans.name: Jesibel

texts.en:
Jesibel P., 36, is a variety store owner and a small piggery operator in Silang, Cavite. She is also a mother of three kids: 8, 3, and a 1 year old. Her eldest now goes to a public school in the agricultural town of Balubad. Jesibel's husband, Richard, is an irregular construction worker.

The store earns a net of P 3,000 a month. The family's daily expenses are barely being covered by the income from Jesibel's small store. Despite the difficulties, Jesibel remains optimistic: "The store's income is growing, that's why I am very keen on getting a loan." She believes that the store has plenty of customers from the community but doesn't have enough products on the racks.

She is going to use this 9,000 PHP loan to buy more goods, such as beverages, canned goods, and chips, for the store. She also plans to improve a part of her store to attract more customers. Jesibel's family is thankful for the chance to improve their livelihood. Part of the store's initial income will be used to buy school supplies and a new pair of shoes for their schooling kid.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions. www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: purchasing canned goods and beverages for her store

loans.name: Betilu

texts.es:
Betilu es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Betilu es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Betilu tiene una tienda en la galería S. Rosa en donde vende loceria, cristalería, producto que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo que también viaja a provincia con los mismos productos.
Betilu necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos y platos.
Los sueños de Betilu son ampliar su negocio con mas productos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Betilu is a member of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II.” Betilu has a partner, is 32 years old and has 2 children. Betilu has a store in the S. Rosa gallery where she sells housewares, glass products, items that she acquires in Lima. She runs her business with the help of her husband who also travels the province with the products. Betilu needs a loan for 1350 soles to invest in buying glasses and plates. Betilu dreams of expanding her business with more products and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glasses and plates

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa T. is from the village of Buyog, Banlag, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old and married with 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells both food and everyday products in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Marissa joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services that might help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her first HSPFI loan of 5000 PHP which was used to purchase additional products for the shop. Marissa is now requesting her 2nd loan, for 8000 PHP, to be used to expand the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in her sar-sari business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es socia del Banco Comunal Minka.
Marcela es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Marcela vende ollas renaware por catálogos, además vende ropa a pedido, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas son al crédito. Marcela tiene proyectado implementar una fuente de soda en su casa.
Marcela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas.
Los sueños de Marcela son que sus hijos salgan adelante y tener una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Para la compra de chompas.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old married man with one child. He has been working as a carpenter since 1999 when he was too young. He is a very hardworking man and with his loan of $1,000 he will invest in buying more supplies and make some modifications in his business to continue earning a good income for his family.

loans.use: buying more supplies and make some modifications in his business

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita B. is from the village of Del Pilar, Baliangao Mis. Occidental. She is 48 years old. Mercidita is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Mercidita owns and operates a business which makes and sells bread in the local community. 

In 2006, Mercidita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercidita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.  She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for additional capital for her existing business. This loan will be the 3rd cycle loan taken out by Mercidita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her existing business

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Y. Nargiz is 29 years old. Her elder son is 7 and already goes to school. Nargiz sells make-up and cosmetics. Her husband has another  shop in a different market. Nargiz has been in the business for 4 years already. This is her first loan however, and she is quite sure that she will be able to repay it in a timely manner. Nargiz dreams of expanding her business, opening a new own store and establish contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. Nargiz and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds to educating their kids so that they will be in high demand for good jobs in the future. Now Nargiz requests $800 US Dollars in order to purchase new make-up, such as lipstick, mascara, powders, skin creams, etc. She wants to enlarge her range of goods. Nargiz would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase her stock of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda has a rice farming business in Norala, South Cotabato. She is married to Joel. They have 5 children; the eldest is 18 years old. She strives hard to survive the difficulties of life. She wants a better life for her family. She does not have enough capital to improve her business. That's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to avail a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. She needs this loan to further improve her farming business.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Susana Rosario

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer emprendedora y muy dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, madre D. 4 hijos D. los cuales uno es mayor D. edad; cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien es contador.
Se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres perseverantes II” desD. hace dos años. 
El primer crédito que recibió fuè D. 300.00 nuevos soleslos que le permitieron invertir en colonias, talcos, lápiz labiales y otros productos D. belleza.  
En la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 3000.00 soles que serán utilizados para la compra D. una gran variedad D. productos D. belleza los que venderà a sus clientes. 
La meta D. Susana es tener una tienda D. prendas D. vestir y accesorios para damas.
texts.en:
Susana is a dynamic and enterprising woman. She lives in Pucalpa, in the region of Ucayali. She's 38 years old, the mother of four children, the oldest of which is grown up. She has the support of her husband who is an accountant. Her livelihood is the sale of beauty products.

She has been a member of the Community Bank's "Mujeres preseverantes II" (Persevering Women II) for two years now. The first loan she received was for S/. 300.00 new soles which enabled her to invest in colognes, powders, lipstick and other beauty products.

She currently needs a loan of S/. 3,000.00 new soles which will be used for the purchase of a wiD. variety of beauty products that she will sell to her customers. Susana's goal is to have a store with clothing and accessories for women.


Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a wide variety of beauty products

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita B. is from the village of Ampinican, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Marcelita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Marcelita owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products such as lumpia (spring rolls) in the local community. Marcelita has been engaged in her business for over fpur years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marcelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Marcelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make lumpia for sale

loans.name: Zonie

texts.en:
Zonie L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 23 years old. Zonie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Zonie owns & operates a business selling snacks, processed food, fruit juices and soft drinks in the local community. Zonie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Zonie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zonie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make his products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zonie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby G. is 36 years old. She lives in Coastal Place on Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines with her husband and four children. She and her husband, Mr. Efren, have not finished their studies at college because neither of their families could afford to pay for their education. The couple is working hard to give a better education to their children and they want a better life as well.


They decided to join ASHI in 2007 to get capital for their fishing business. They have requested a new loan of PHP 20,000. They will invest this capital to buy their own pump boat, 20 pcs. of bubo (shrimp catcher) and fish feed.


She hopes to build their own dream house, expand her fishing business and to have more room for their fishing materials. She is grateful to the ASHI and KIVA partnership that provides loans that contribute to changing their lives.

loans.use: To buy a pump boat, bubo(shrimp catcher) and fish feed.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
doña Maria del Rosario F. es una mujer emprendedora y bien dedicada a su trabajo. es madre de 2 hijos.
