todos los dias se lavanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a su clientela. 
tiene bastantes clientes porque donde esta ubicado su negocio transita mucha gente a diario.
esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio y hacerlo crecer mas.
se siente muy feliz ya que cuando comenzo tenia poco inventario y ahora es una pulperia bien surtida. su meta es hacerlo crecer mas y mas cada dia que pasa.
las ganancias las ocupa para mantener su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario F. is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her work. She has two children. She gets up at five in the morning everyday to take care of her customers. She has plenty of customers because lots of people pass by her business location everyday . She is asking for a loan to better stock her business and make it grow more. She is happy because when she started she had little inventory, and now her mini-market is well stocked. Her goal is to make it grow more and more with every passing day. Her earnings are to support her household and to give her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, shortening, oil, tortillas, churros, corn and wheat flour, coffee, locks, matches, vegetables, soft drinks, and dairy products

loans.name: Peter Ngige

texts.en:
Peter is 34 year old and married to Lucy Wangeni. They have two children: Paul is 12 years old and Magdaline is 10 years old.

Peter, who is on his second loan, was introduced to KADET by his sister, who was also a client. Peter has been selling fish for three years. His business is located in Malindi's old town market where his target-customers are the towns’ residents. Peter also does watch repairs as a secondary business. He is able to earn a monthly profit of 8,000 KES from this business. Peter hopes to put the profits he earns from this loan toward buying a piece of land.

He describes himself as very hardworking and ambitious, and he hopes to own a good house and promising businesses.

loans.use: Opening a retail shop worth 30,000 KES; adding fish stock worth 10,000 KES; and purchasing a deep freezer for storing his fish worth 30,000 KES

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 51 years old, married with four children and lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hard working and very supportive to her husband in keeping the home. Some of her children are still in school and some are out of school. 

Bola operates a restaurant. She sells drinks, pepper soup and cooked food. She does this business to sustain herself and her family. She has been in the business for over 12 years. Her husband is a businessman who also works to meet his financial responsibilities at home. 

Bola is a member of LAPO microfinance with a good record. She hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and food items to cook and sell. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and food to sell.

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en:
Olaide sells cooked foods to make a living. With this business, she hopes to make more profit. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and to sell. 

Olaide is 27 years old and married with two children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA INES  ES SOLTERA, ES UNA SEÑORA MUY TRABAJADORA, VIVE CON SUS HERMANOS YA QUE ELLA NO CUENTA CON UN DOMICILIO PROPIO, TIENE UNA MAQUINA TEJEDORA MANUAL EN LA QUE CONFECCIONA CHOMPAS DE LANA Y LAS COMERCIALIZA EN UNO DE LOS MERCADOS MAS CONOCIDOS DE EL ALTO Y  DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA ACTUALMENTE CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO TIENE EN MENTE COMPRAR UNA MAQUINA MAS GRANDE Y CONTRATAR A ALGUIEN QUE LE AYUDE CON LA CONFECCION Y ASÍ PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, ELLA ES UNA PERSONA QUE TIENE MUCHAS METAS Y SOBRE TODO MUCHAS GANAS DE TRABAJAR, TIENE EL APOYO DE SUS HERMANOS QUIENES LA QUIEREN MUCHO YA QUE ELLA CUIDO DE ELLOS DESDE PEQUEÑA Y LA QUIEREN COMO UN MADRE Y LA RESPETAN Y LE APOYAN EN TODAS LAS DESICIONES QUE ELLA TOMA.

LA SRA. INES ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Ines is a single, very hardworking woman. She lives with her brothers because she doesn’t have her own home. She has a hand operated knitting machine with which she makes wool sweaters that she sells in some of the better known markets of El Alto and the city of La Paz. Her current thought is that with the money from the loan she will buy a bigger machine and hire someone to help her make sweaters. In this way she will be able to make her business grow. Sra. Ines is a person who has a lot of goals. Above all she wants her business to succeed. She has the support of her brothers who love her a lot since she cared for them since they were little. They love and respect her like a mother and support all her decisions. Sra. Ines is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a knitting machine.

loans.name: Judy Sulema

texts.es: Judy Sulema C. C. de 20 años de edad, reside en Tacachico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. A su corta edad, Judy trabaja para poder sostener un hogar y a dos hermanos los cuales tienen 15 y 8 años de edad, los cuales están al total cuidado de Judy. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado de Tacachico, un lugar muy apropiado para este tipo de ventas, ya que ha pesar que en algunas ocasiones sus ventas son pocas, las obtiene a diario. Judy es una personas muy emprendedor quien desea mejorar su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda surtir el negocio, comprando productos por mayor, y de esta forma ella pueda aumentar sus ventas. Esto es de mucha importancia para Judy ya que es la única que trabaja para mantener a su familia, por lo que su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Judy Sulema C. C., age 20, lives in Tacachico, which is located in the La Libertad department. At her young age, Judy works to be able to support a household and her two siblings. They are 15 and 8 years old, and they are totally under Judy’s care. She has a store in which she sells basic needs items. It is located in the market in Tacachico, which is a very appropriate place for this type of sales. Even though sometimes she has few sales, she makes daily sales. Judy is a very hard-working person who wants to improve her business. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral. She will use the loan to stock her business by purchasing wholesale products. That way she will be able to increase her sales. This is very important to Judy because she is the only one who works to support her family. Therefore, her greatest desire is to be able to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 41 años, convive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos en su haber. Residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia a base de madera. Sofía es una mujer que se caracteriza, por el coraje y la humildad que tiene con los demás, reconoce que tuvo caídas en su pasado, uno de ellos en la actividad agrícola, debido a los cambios que tiene el clima que perjudicó toda su plantación de cacao, no servían ni para vender. Pero su voluntad y entereza hizo que continuará cultivando y poco a poco se fue recuperando. Hoy su tiempo de trabajo lo ha complementado, dedicándose por las tardes a la lavandería artesanal, donde ya tiene varios clientes fieles a ella, por lo que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que esta obteniendo, ya que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos domésticos. En cuanto a su chacra lo dejó bajo responsabilidad de su pareja, quien cuida de las plagas que puedan afectar a sus plantaciones de cacao. Su plan a futuro es comprar una lavadora, para que así pueda minimizar tiempo y costo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pago. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de jabones, escobillas, lejías, detergentes, con la fin de poder realizar bien su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sofía, 41, lives together with her partner and has 2 children with him. She lives in the suburn of Quimbiri, located in the top of the Peruvian jungle, where she has her own house made from wood. Sofía is a woman characterised by courage and humility, of which she has both. She recognises that she has had failures in the past, one of these in agricultural activity, owing to the changes in climate which damaged her cocoa plantation, making it unable to be sold. But Sofía's will and determination made her continue to cultivatecocoa and little by little the crops recovered. Now she has a complementary job, in the afternoons providing a by-hand laundry service, where she has many loyal customers. She is satisfied by the earnings she obtains as they help her cover her domestic costs. Sofía has left her farm under the care of her partner, who looks after the plagues that can affect her cocoa plantations. Her future plan is to purchase a washing mashine, so she can minimise time and costs. This is Sofía's first loan with MFP, and she promises to meet the payment timeline. With the loan she is seeking she will invest in the purchase of soaps, brushes, bleach, and detergents, to be able to do her job well.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with one child who goes to school. With the Ksh 20,000, she hopes to buy cloth, sewing thread, and a sewing machine. Her business involves making school uniforms and other clothing for the entire community. Janet has been operating her in-house tailoring business for the past six years. Her other source of income is her spouse's salary.

She faces the challenge of seasonality as demand fluctuates. She hopes to progress in life by expanding her in-house tailoring business to a very competitive market arena. Janet decided to join Yehu so as get a loan to start a business. She rents a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food.

loans.use: To buy cloth, sewing thread, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old and she is still single.  Jacqueline makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop, and this is her 4th successful year in this business.  Jacqueline's business is open from 6 am to 7 pm every day.

After realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Jacqueline is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Jacqueline will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: A variety of goods including cosmetics and foodstuffs

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is married with a teenage son. She owns a clothing sales business in the central marketplace of her home town of Beregovo. She started this small venture five years ago and presently has 12,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 - 5,000 Grivnyas a month.

Silviya is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to re-stock her seasonal merchandise. She is seeking to keep a nice selection of good-quality clothing at affordable prices in her vending kiosk.

Silviya has proved to be reliable with all her previous loans, having repaid them without any delinquencies. Her family is very supportive and helpful in all her business endeavors.

loans.use: To re-stock her seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang H., 57, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its quality palm products. H. and her husband produce Cambodian noodles to sell, earning an income of USD 15 per day.

H. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase more supplements to expand her daughter’s make-up business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy supplements to expand her daughter's make-up business

loans.name: Khuy

texts.en: Mr. Khuy T. is a 52-year-old father of five children who are living at home. Khuy T. owns an old motorcycle that he uses to provide a taxi service, while his wife is a good homemaker who arranges a daily routine and takes care of the children. To help meet with the family financial crisis, three of his daughters are employed in the garment industry. Khuy T. lives in an older house which needs repairs, so Khuy T. will be using his first loan to mend and decorate his house. Mr. Khuy T. was not available when the photograph was taken so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To mend and decorate their old house.

loans.name: Frederic Francois

texts.en:
Francois was born in 1988 and is married with three children: the first one is 18, the next is 14, and the last is 12. There is no one else in his family who works and, for that reason, he has to work hard so that he can provide all the basic needs of his family.

Francois is seasoned enough in his business, obviously, because he has four years of experience. The hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day.

Francois is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more bales of clothes to sell. This expansion will allow him to satisfy his customers and attract new ones as well.

With the profits that Francois expects to earn, he will reinvest in his business and pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchasing more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Doña Ana, es una señora de 35 años  de edad, reside en la Colonia San José, San Francisco Gotera, vive con sus cuatro hijos de las edades de 18, 15, 12, 6 años siendo madre soltera, ella posee un negocio de venta de tortillas y tamales y que atiende desde la cinco de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde para la elaboración de las tortillas, la venta de tamales la realiza una vez por semana, ella tiene ocho años de dedicarse a este oficio.
Ella está solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de leña y maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas y los tamales, con la obtención del crédito Doña Ana se beneficia por que podrá comprar la leña y el maíz por mayor cantidad, encontrando su precio más bajo de lo normal, logrando mayores ganancias en sus ventas, viéndose con mayores ingresos su hogar para cubrir sus necesidades.
Su sueño es poder realizar a sus hijos, dándoles la oportunidad de que estudien y se preparen para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 35-year-old woman residing in Colonia San Jose, San Francisco Gotera. She lives with her 4 children, ages 18, 15, 12, and 6, as a single mother. Ana has a business selling tortillas and tamales, which she attends from 5:00am until 1:00pm, making tortillas. She sells tamales once a week. Ana has been involved in this trade for 8 years. Ana is soliciting a loan to buy firewood and corn to make tortillas and tamales. The loan will be of benefit by allowing her to buy firewood and corn in larger quantities, at a price below normal, and to obtain better earnings on her sales, resulting in higher household income to cover necessities. Ana's dream is to be able to advance her children, giving them the opportunity to study and prepare themselves to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SUPPLIES TO MAKE AND SELL TORTILLAS AND TAMALESVenta de tortillas y tamales

loans.name: Avenida Del Trabajo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Avenida del trabajo” y escogieron este nombre porque el lugar donde se reúnen es en la calle que lleva este nombre, además de que ellas son muy trabajadoras y le hacen honor a este nombre. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de Tepeapulco en Hidalgo, y llevan 5 ciclos trabajando con CrediComún y está conformado por 11 integrantes.
Irma A. M. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 31 años, vive en unión libre, estudió hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos, de 4, 7 9 Y 10 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a pintar casas, edificios etc., pero al ver la poca estabilidad laboral y por lo tanto la económica de su pareja, opta por emprender un negocio para apoyar en la economía y par la calidad elevar de vida de sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, el cual inicio aproximadamente hace 1 año, momento en el que solicito su primer crédito en esta financiera y, que hasta el día de hoy a podido incrementar tanto su producción como sus ventas, gracias a los créditos que se le han otorgado en el tiempo que ha trabajado con nosotros. La señora Irma nos comenta de la responsabilidad que representa pertenecer a una institución como la nuestra, ya que siente la reciprocidad que esta empresa otorga a cada una de las integrantes de este y todos los grupos. 
María Elena Ramírez B. es tesorera este grupo. Tiene 39 años, estudió una carrera técnica, Vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, en la cual cuenta con una experiencia de 8 años, sin embargo aproximadamente 1 año y medio tuvo una caída económica por lo cual al enterarse de las facilidades y ventajas que tenia la financiera al otorgar créditos, vio una oportunidad de poder reactivar su negocio a través de los prestamos que se le han otorgado. Los clientes que conocen a la Sra. Elena comentan que ha la fecha han notado un gran crecimiento en su negocio ya que anteriormente no contaba con algunos productos y después del apoyo ya ofrece productos que no se localizan en otros negocios del mismo giro.
texts.en:
This group is called “Avenida del Trabajo” (Avenue of Work) because the street where they gather to conduct their meetings has the same name. In addition, the women of this group are hardworking so the name is appropriate for them. The group meets in the town of Tepeapulco in Hidalgo and consists of eleven members. They have participated in five loan cycles with CrediComún.

Irma A. M. is the president of the group. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and studied through high school. Irma works as a merchant and has four children (ages 4, 7, 8, and 10). Her husband paints houses and buildings, but since he has very little job security, she decided to start a business to help with the finances and raise the quality of life for her children. A year ago, Irma started a business selling Mexican street food. Thanks to the loans she has received while working with CrediComún, she has been able to increase her production as well as her sales. Sra. Irma says the responsibility for her success lies with CrediComún as well as with her group. She experiences the “give and take” relationship that the Institution has with all of the groups and each of the members.

María Elena Ramírez B. is the group treasurer. She is 39 years old and earned a technical degree. María Elena is in a common law marriage and has two children. She sells groceries and has eight years of experiences. Approximately a year and a half ago, as a result of the economic downturn, María Elena learned about the services and advantages available from receiving loans. She saw this as an opportunity to restart her business using the loans she received. Her customers have noted the tremendous growth in her business because she now offers products that she did not have previously and are not being offered by any other businesses in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mr. Mon B. is 20 years of age and a single man. He is a water-factory worker in Phnom Penh City. He has been in this sector for many years and is earning approximately $3 per day. 

Mr. Mon B. tries to work in order to support his family, with the other relatives in different jobs. Currently, he is concerned that he faces difficulties in traveling to his workplace. Mr. Mon B. always travels to work by hiring a taxi or walking because he doesn't have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Mr. Mon B. has requested a loan in the amount of $800 to be used to buy a used motorbike to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Vanessa Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Aquí conversamos con las señora Vanessa, ella tiene 27 años de edad, hace tres años su marido falleció y según nos cuenta su vida ha sido muy dura ya que ha tenido que  hacerse cargo de todos los gastos de su familia y de sus tres hijos de 11 - - 10 – y 8 años de edad y que aun están en escuela.

Trabaja de lunes a viernes en una dulcería en el centro de la ciudad, pero los fines de semana se dedica a su propio negocio ya que con lo que sabe ella prepara y vende dulces para fiestas, los mismos que entrega para las recepciones que realizan en un centro de actos todos los fines de semana, se dedica a su negocio los sábados y domingos desde las 7am hasta las 17h00, este negocio le permite ganar ingresos que le sirven para el sustento de su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la elaboración de los dulces. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque le ha ayudado a mejorar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
In the El Progresso neighborhood of Portoviejo the Ilusiones community bank meets every two weeks.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal urban area of the city which is known as 'the prison sector' because the Portoviejo women's prison is located in this area.

Here we speak to Vanessa who is 27 years old.  Her husband died three years ago and she tells us that her life has been very hard because she has had to look after all her family expenses and her three children who are 11, 10 and 8 years old and still in school.

She works from Monday to Friday in a confectionery store in the city center but on weekends she runs her own business as she takes what she knows and prepares, sells and delivers confectionery for parties and receptions which take place in an events center every weekend.  She works in her business on Saturdays and Sundays from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  This business allows her to make a profit which helps her support her family.

This loan will be used to buy products to prepare her confectionery.  This is her fourth loan cycle with the community bank which she likes because it has helped her to improve her business.

Her dream is for her children to get a good education and become good people.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making confectionery

loans.name: Señoras De Fe Group

texts.es:
SEÑORAS DE FE
Este grupo está conformado por doña María Santos P. B. de 45 años, tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años hace comales,  compra y vende,  ella los fabrica en su casa y está muy contenta porque con eso sostiene a su familia. También esta doña Miriam Verónica Q. de 20 años solicita el cradito para agrandar su venta de productos de la canasta basica doña Aura Marina C. C. ella es la líder de este grupo y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, desde hace 7 años pero ella nos cuenta que para poder agrandar su negocio necesita mucho capital ya que la ropa típica es muy cara, pero con lo poquito que tiene la gente le pide más y por eso ella quiere surtir mas su negocio, tiene 4 hijos y con su pequeño negocio ha ido superándose, ella confía en que fape le pueda dar la oportunidad de agrandar su negocio y así poder crecer porque necesita el dinero para comprar más ropa y venderla, y a la vez quedar bien con su clientela.
texts.en:
WOMEN OF FAITH

Mrs. María Santos P. B., 45, is a member of this group.  She has two children and for the last 10 years has made griddles to sell.  She makes them in her house and is very happy because she supports her family through this work. 

Another member is Mrs. Miriam Verónica Q., 20.  She is requesting funds to enlarge her grocery sales business.

Mrs. Aura Marina C. C. is the group leader and she has sold typical clothing for the last 7 years.  However, she tells us that in order to expand her business she needs a lot of capital because typical costumes are very expensive.  Even though she has little available still people ask her for more and that’s why she wants to enlarge her stock.  She has four children and her small business has made it possible for her to get ahead gradually.  She trusts that Fape will be able to give her the opportunity to enlarge her business so that she can grow because she needs the money to buy more clothes to sell and meet customer demand.

loans.use: To make woven articles, sale of griddles and basic grocery items.

loans.name: Raul Nicolas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raul; El socio tiene 28 años de edad, el socio es soltero y el trabaja independientemente en cada obra que se le presente, el es arquitecto; el socio ahora está ahorrando su dinerito para poder poner su estudio y pagar sus alquileres el también amoblará y comprará todo lo que requiere un estudio de arquitectura poco a poco. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos materiales de arquitectura y ahorrar para poder pagar alquileres de una nueva oficina.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the Sacsayhuaman Community Bank located in the Huanchac district of Cuzco. Mr. Raul is 28 years old, single, and works independently on every job that is presented to him. He is an architect and is currently saving his money to have his own studio and pay the rent. Little by little he will also furnish the studio and buy everything an architectural studio needs. He is asking for the loan to buy some architectural supplies and to save to pay for rent in a new office.

He is thankful and values the loan provided through these means and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: To buy architecture supplies and to save to pay rent in a new office

loans.name: Fernando Gualberto

texts.es:
Fernando Gualberto F. F. tiene 29 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fernando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta pasar con la familia y dedicarse al trabajo y el deporte
texts.en:
Fernando Gualberto F. F. is 29 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the San Miguel canton (subdivision) of the Bolivar province. He has two children. 

The V.R.C. Yagui Grande is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office which belongs to the San Miguel canton. This solidarity group is dedicated to short-cycle farming of corn and potatoes. They have been doing this for a long time. 

Fernando dedicates himself to farming corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays. 

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn and potatoes. The help from this loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the changes in the climate. His dream is to be able to build a home. 

He likes to spend time with his family and to dedicate himself to work and sports.

loans.use: Agriculture supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen C., from the village of Kibaning, Kalilangan, Bukidnon, is 26 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Airen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as soaps, detergents, snack foods, canned goods and viand foods such as pancit bihon in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Airen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products to sell including beverages and biscuits, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sesoi Ene

texts.en:
Sesoi Ene has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is 52 years old and married to Musama Mereu. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan amount to buy sheep, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Sesoi hopes to run a curio shop parallel to her livestock farming to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: To buy sheep, which she will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita O. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Tita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling mostly stick brooms to local businesses and community members. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional materials needed and as working capital. Tita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Tita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline V. is from the village of Manil. She is 28 years old. Evangeline is married with two children. To make a living, Evangeline buys and sells fish in the local community.  Her monthly income is 15,000 PHP.

In 2008, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and  living situation. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more fish to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

location.town: Sindangan-Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Arly

texts.en:
Arly is a 52-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Arly is borrowing PHP 19,500 to fund her business operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Arly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To funds her business operations

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children who all attend school.  She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for five years now and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces maize, beans, milk and bananas, which are all sold locally. She also runs a hotel business in the same town.

She has requested a loan of 46,800 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help her in educating her children and providing for the basic needs of her family. Her major challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and poor prices for her farm produce. She hopes to own at least five quality dairy cows in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
From Phnom Penh City of Cambodia, sewing clothes is the key part of 31-year-old Try S.’s daily routine. She provides her service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well, and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. 

She is married to Meng Vuthy, 33, a chief of construction workers, and they have two children. Two of their daughters are studying in the local school.

Try S. will use half of her loan to mend her old house, and the rest of the money to buy more tailoring tools for her sewing business.

loans.use: To mend her old house and to buy more tailoring tools for her sewing business.

loans.name: Justina Emperatriz

texts.es: Justina Emperatriz tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Tiene más de 6 años en este negocio, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona luchadora y que disfruta de su medio de vida. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos para su negocio por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Su mayor desafío ha sido su salud, por lo que algunas veces ella se siente indispuesta y no puede abrir la pulpería, pues esto le ocasiona pérdidas con sus clientes y ciertos productos. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, galletas, granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, pan entre otros.
texts.en: Justina Emperatriz has had a small store for six years and through this, she has proven to be a hardworking woman who enjoys her work.  This is not her first time requesting a loan for her business, which is why she is happy with her business.  Her greatest challenge has been her health, as she sometimes does not feel well and cannot open the store, thus resulting in a loss of customers and certain products.  This loan is for the purchase of candy, soft drinks, crackers, basic grains, soups, canned goods, bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, crackers, basic grains, soups, canned goods, bread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Mi nombre es Maria Guadalupe, vivo en san francisco tlalchichilpa, mi negocio es vender cokteles de fruta, ya tengo en carrito con el que camino para vender los vasos de coktel, solicite mi prestamo para poder comprar una lona nueva para que me cubra del sol y tambien a los cokteles, tambien quiero comprar un mantel nuevo y comprar la fruta que me hace falta, honestamente vendo bien en mi negocio por el lado de las ventas no me quejo, solo seria el estar caminando empejundo el carro y en la temporada donde hace frio pues las ventas si bajan, pero ahorita me va ir bien ya que estamos en tiempos donde hace mucho sol, y a la gente le gusta se le antoja las cosas frescas, el prestamome va ayudar a tener mas solvencia economica y mejorar mi calidad de vida, y mis deseos son terminar mi casa que empezamos hacer, tengo 2 niños que estudian, tengo 33 años de edad vivo en union libre desde hace 15 años, vivo con mi esposo el trabaja como taxista.
texts.en: "My name is Maria Guadalupe, and I live in San Francisco Tlalchichilpa. My business is selling fruit salads. I have a cart that I walk with to sell the cups of fruit salad. I am requesting my loan so that I can buy a new tarp that will protect me from the sun and will also protect the fruit salads. I would also like to buy a new coat and buy the fruit that I need. Honestly, I sell well in my business, and I can't complain about the sales; it is only the walking and pushing the cart in the season when it gets cold, because sales go down. But now it is going to go well for me, since we are in the times when there is a lot of sun, and the people like to snack on something cool. The loan will help me to have better economic solvency and improve my quality of life. My desire is to finish my house, which we have started to build. I have 2 children who are in school. I am 33 years old and I have been living in a common-law marriage for 15 years. I live with my husband who works as a taxi driver."

loans.use: to buy a new canvas tarp and fruit to make her fruit salads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar and canned goods

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en: Crescencia works hard to support her family. She is married and owns a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Crescencia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Kagala Development Group

texts.en:
16 years is the length of time that 49-year-old Dodovico has demonstrated his hard work ethic in his food sales business in the many food markets in and around the metropolis of Mukono. Dodovico is a family man who takes pride in the fact that his is a stable family with 2 buoyant children aged 22 and 25. They are all in good schools and giving a good account of themselves. He says his wife is always at his beck and call, helping him as he sells his food (bananas, sweet potatoes and beans). 

The difficult experiences he has gone through in the past 16 years of running this business have made him come to terms with what he needs to do to elevate his business prospects. He has also learnt to take stock of what will create a bigger niche for his business and how to make the best out of bad business bargains. In this kind of business, one is destined to climb the ladder of financial success as long as you continuously restock because demand for food will be high, even if food prices rise. Dodovico has always strived to restock whenever he runs short on supplies. 

This business was started with cash savings from his previous charcoal and timber trade. Weekly, he says this business generates shillings 100,000 profit. With this loan, he is going to purchase more foods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, sweet potatoes and beans to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter Njoroge is a 47 year old farmer, and he is married to a woman who is also a farmer. They have adult children.  He has been in mixed-crop farming for the past 10 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 2,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his sixth loan from KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the money to purchase fertilizer and seedlings, which will be used on his farm during this planting season. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming activities. His future dream is to export his farm's produce to other areas.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Duo La Montañita Group

texts.es:
DUO LA MONTAÑITA:
La señora Delmi, ella es una mujer  trabajadora que cada dia se dedica a sus labores desD. temprano hasta horas D. la noche para apoyar a su esposo ya que son D. escasos recursos económicos y  se dedica a la elaboración D. tejidos típicos a mano y también se dedica a la crianza D. animales ya que tienen bajo su responsabilidad a dos menores D. edad y que con el trabajo D. ella tienen que salir adelante ya que su esposo es D. escasos recursos y lo que gana no alcanza para los gastos D. la familia.el credito´que ella esta solicitando es para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos,  La señora Maria se dedica la compra y venta D. laurel para el sostenimiento D. su hogar  ya que por medio D. su actividad ella apoya a su esposo en los gastos D. la familia  tienen  bajo su responsabilidad  a cinco hijos menores D. edad que nencesitan el apoyo D. sus padres para una mejor educación y para que tengan un futuro  mejor, y que sus hijos salgan adelante con el esfuerzo D. ella.
texts.en:
'LA MONTAÑITA' group:

Delmi is a hard-working woman who starts work early each morning and keeps going until late at night in order to support her husband as they are of limited financial means.  Delmi makes traditional woven products by hand and also raises animals as she has two dependent children to support.  She needs to work in order to get her children ahead in life as what her husband earns isn't enough to cover their family expenses.  She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for weaving.

Maria buys and sells bay leaves in order to support her household.  Through her business she supports her husband in covering their family expenses.  She has five dependent children in her care who need the support of their parents in order to receive a decent education and enjoy a better future.  Maria works hard to get her children ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Blue Arrow Group

texts.en:
Joushua, 27, earns his keep from a restaurant business in the ever busy and melting pot metropolis of Jinja. Five years is the amount of time he has been diligently bearing a hand in this business venture that he began with savings from his previous teaching job. Joushua is happily married with two children who are all in school and doing well. 

A restaurant business cannot go wrong if one has a steady working capital base. This means that individuals operating that business will be in a position to restock the business every time the restaurant runs short on food.

With the current status quo where food prices are rising day in, day out, a person involved in this enterprise may fail to sustain it without a robust capital base. Joushua says this is not likely to happen in his business as he has quite a sufficient working capital. Not so big, he says, but at least strong enough to ensure he remains in business. It's just that he has other business operational expenses, which at times constrain his capital base and make it hard for him to make enough food purchases.
 
This business generates 18,000 Ugandan shillings weekly in sales revenue. This is quite paltry given the fact that food prices are up and most restaurant owners are increasing their food prices. Though his weekly sales revenue is minimal, he is not one to get disconsolate. He reckons he will be able to make sales income once he can get this loan to improve operations at his business. This Kiva loan, he says, is to aid him in the purchase of more food for his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more food for his restaurant.

loans.name: Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLLPANI” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosmery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, servicios y producción.
 
La señora Rosmery,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en general que viene trabajando hace tres años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de harina, azucar, arroz, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto)  y posteriormente los venderá en la tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta convivir con las socias.

En la fotografía no se encuentra Julia ya que su religión no le permite.
texts.en:
The “Collpani” communal bank will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Rosmery.  The members carry out a variety of businesses such as: commerce, service and production.

Rosmery indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for two years having joined through an invitation from her girl friends.  Currently she has a general store that she’s been operating for three years having learned from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (to purchase flour, sugar, rice, etc.).  She will buy it in La Ceja (commercial area of the city of El Alto) and then she’ll sell them in her store.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family however possible because she’s married and has two children.


When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes sharing time with her fellow members.

Julia does not appear in the photo because her religion does not allow it.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old and married to Henry. She runs a food kiosk as her primary business and also has rental houses as her secondary business. She has been operating the businesses for the last 6 years, making a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 

Rose has been loaned 40,000 KES, which she plans to use to purchase more potatoes. With the anticipated profits made, she will expand her business. 

In the near future she hopes to expand her business and complete her rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes for use

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika Savings Group D

texts.en:
Norah, 32 years old has been in the beauty salon business for the past seven years. The mother of three plies her business in Kampala. Beauty salons in Kampala do great business, mostly on the weekends. Most of these salons depend on word of mouth public relations. The majority of the salon owners tend as much as possible to get into the good graces of their clients. This, without a shadow of a doubt, impacts significantly on the businesses. These salons are in most cases frequented by women who are inclined to stay in vogue. Most of the salon owners invariably want to be at the beck and call of their clients.

Entrepreneurs like Norah have banked on stocks in trade similar to the aforementioned. Norah says she set forth in her business with a friend's prevail upon influence. Her weekly gross income totals Uganda shillings 130,000.

She intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase better cosmetics and other salon equipment to use at her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase better cosmetics and other salon equipment to use at her beauty salon

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Daniel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas y patos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa teniendo otro para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar de alimento para engordar a sus animales y fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras, al igual que su producto y así venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con esos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida. Daniel es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que lo único que quiere es poder brindarle algunas comodidades a su familia y que logren sus ideales.
texts.en:
Daniel is 49 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in his own home, which only has electricity service (no running water).  It is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district, which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is characterized by its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For the last several years, Daniel has been working raising and selling farmyard poultry (chickens and ducks).  His farmyard is located in the area behind his house, which is fully suitable for this purpose.  He feeds them with balanced feed and natural grains, so that his poultry will reach an optimal size.  Then he can offer them for sale in the different markets in the area, and so obtain very good earnings to cover the daily expenses of his family.  He also has some agricultural fields where he grows lemons, and once they have been harvested, he sells them from his house.

He has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles through Edpyme Alternativa for buying feed to fatten his poultry, and fertilizer to improve his fields and his crop, and so sell them to his customers for a better price.  With these income sources, he will be able to pay back his loan and improve his quality of life.

Daniel is someone who is very dedicated to his work, as the only thing he wants is to be able to provide several comforts for his family, and to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy more balanced feed for his poultry, and fertilizer to improve his agricultural fields

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married to a farmer and they both live together with their six dependants in Abura. She buys fresh fish at the seashore and comes home to fry them to sell at the market in Jukwa, Central Region of Ghana. She wants to increase her quantity of fried fish. A loan will go a long way to help buy additional fish to fry to sell.

loans.use: to help buy additional fish to fry to sell.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children.

Haydar has owned a shop since 2000, selling installation materials and electrical appliances. He obtained this business from his father, from whom he gained a good deal of experience. He is well known in his area, he has a lot of potential customers passing by, and he has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to make a sliding door and showcases and to buy additional inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and a showcase and to buy additional inventories.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary owns a clothes shop, which she has run for seven years. She got the idea knowing that there are many who travel to Malindi to visit the town. She is married and has a 4-year-old child who has just started kindergarten. They live in Malindi town of the Coastal Province, Kenya. The main challenge with her business comes during the low season between February and July when there are low sales. Many tourists leave the town during the time of August through to January of the following year. 

Rosemary was invited to join Milango by her friends and has been a client of Milango Financial Services for eight months. A loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings will help her restock her stall in preparation for December festivities. She desires to restock her business from the actual manufacturers and not through middlemen – a feat she can only achieve with higher capital. Rosemary intends to open other clothes shops within Malindi town. This loan will help improve her life, save and make plans for her young child.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal is 42 years old, widowed, and has two children, both of whom attend college. She lives with them in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province,  Mongolia. 

Bayanjargal started her garment retailing business in 2003 by renting a counter in a market. She is well known for her fashionable goods and her excellent service. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy some warm clothes to sell. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "It has been difficult since my husband passed away however I never stepped back, I will rest when my kids are graduated and employed." 

Bayanjargal is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT, which she will use to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en:
Sa Em (pictured above) and her husband, Koem Cheth, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two children: one son and one daughter.

Sa Em is a weaver. Additionally, she buys additional silk fabric from her fellow villagers and transports it to sell in other provinces. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more finished silk fabrics for resale. That’s why she is applying for another loan in the amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To buy additional finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: From Kampong Chhnang province, Mrs. Eam, a 55-year-old single woman, is a hardworking farmer. She is in the business of making bamboo baskets besides farming, earning approximately $1.50 per day. Presently, Eam lives with her brother, 30, a local rice cultivator. During this harvesting season, Eam would like to buy stocks of rice at a low cost from local farmers to store in her house and to resell for a profit in the future. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner HKL to use as capital to purchase stocks of rice. In the future, she hopes she will be able to expand her business and improve her  standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice.

loans.name: Krombon Group

texts.en:
Clement is the facilitator of the Krombon group. Clement and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Clement and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Clement takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to have a difference in the production rate of his harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Clement had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Clement was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Clement will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Krombon group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Clement pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Furteliana

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Furteliana is a married woman with five children aged between 13 and 27. Furteliana has a tricycle transportation business in Talibon, Bohol. Furteliana is also interested in venturing into other kinds of business. She does her best to take care of her family and improve their living situation.

Furteliana has requested this loan to buy tires and other spare parts. She hopes to save more for her future plans.

loans.use: to buy tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Umoja Mikalanga Group

texts.en:
Donatus is a 32-year-old father of three children. Two of his children attend primary education. He is a good farmer dealing with the production of coffee, maize, and beans together with sugar cane for over 3 years. He has challenges with farming activities - basically a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Donatus spends most of his time finding money to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He is also working hard to meet his target of increasing the scale of production from 5 to 13 acres, remedy his house, and own private transport in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 35 years old and married to Esther. They are blessed with three children, ages 8, 6, and 1. He has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Raphael will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Onesmas

texts.en: Onesmas is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a good and principled man. He operates a Nissan with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a busy town. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay to have his Nissan repaired. His business goal is to be the best transport provider within five years.

loans.use: To pay to repair his Nissan.

loans.name: Fullah Group

texts.en:
Alimamy is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Alimamy was born in Makeni city about thirty-two years ago.  He is married to a trader and the couple have three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. 

For nine years now, Alimamy has been a businessman.  He sells market food – onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc.  With the help of this loan, Alimamy and members of his group will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Alimamy is going to use his share of the loan to buy onions, margi, palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy onions, margi, palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to his business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 29-year-old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of providing motor vehicle transportation, while at the same time he does farming that adds more income.

Richard is faced with challenges of poor roads and competition, which cause constant breakdowns which are costly to him. Besides that, he has hopes of having a bigger vehicle that he can use to carry more people and fetch more income. He has asked for a loan to buy spare parts for his motor vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 33 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 9 years. One of them goes to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 5 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Lyneth

texts.en:
Lyneth is 49 years old and married with two children. Lyneth works very hard to provide for them.

Lyneth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell such as, eggs, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, canned goods, shampoo and other personal care products.

Lyneth has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Lyneth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell such as, eggs, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, canned goods, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is a 44-year old dedicated community health worker (CHW). She lives in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and eight children. Prior to 2002, she earned her income by selling second-hand clothes.  She was then trained by KMET in home-based HIV/AIDS care and was given a small stock of drugs as a start up kit.  Through her own initiative and hard work and supported by KMET Janet intends to use the loan to expand her business at the community pharmacy.  

As there is no chemist in her area, people come from quite a distance to buy drugs from her pharmacy. She moved her business to this more prominent and spacious location (pictured) two years ago in order to meet the growing demand.  Her friendly demeanor and approach to her clients and customers has earned her respect and a good reputation. The community likes her work and has grown accustomed to her, thus ensuring the successful continuity of her business.

loans.use: To improve the community pharmacy stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy 3 bales of second-hand clothes and improve the business premises

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Ms. Akouavi D. is a great merchant in Aklakou. Born in 1957 in Grand Popo (in Bénin), she is married and the mother of six. She possesses over 30 years of experience in the corn trade, a business she learned from her mother. And it is very worthwhile for her, a woman who is well-known in her area. A strict manager, she earns the minimum necessary to provide for her family's needs.

Today, challenged by a growing demand for food, she must furnish more corn to the marketplace. So she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to supply herself with corn from areas where it is grown. The loan will allow her to acquire, transport, process, and stock up on corn to sell it in times of shortage. She can then satisfy her family's needs better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1957 à Grand Popo au Bénin, Madame Akouavi D. est une grande commerçante d’Aklakou. Mariée et mère de six enfants, elle possède une trentaine d’années d’expérience. Héritage de sa mère, le stockage et la vente de maïs est une activité très rentable pour Mme Akouavi, une femme bien connue dans sa localité. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activité, elle en tire le minimum nécessaire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Aujourd’hui, face à une demande grandissante en besoin alimentaire, Madame Akouavi doit fournir davantage de maïs sur le marché. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $1200 pour aller dans les localités de production de maïs, l’acheter, le transporter, le traiter, le stocker et le revendre en période de soudure. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying, transporting, stocking, and selling corn

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A., age 45, is unmarried, has one child, and also has two other dependents. Due to the income from her business selling grocery items and beverages, she manages to meet household needs.

Today, her ambition is to bolster her business and to improve her income in order to cover household expenses appropriately. And so she is requesting financial support in the amount of $1200 as capital for selling food and beverages. She possesses a great deal of experience in her domain and will be able to manage her business successfully.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 45 ans, Madame A. Abra est une femme célibataire avec un enfant. Elle a à sa charge deux autres personnes. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits d'alimentation général et des boissons. C'est grâce au revenu tiré de cette activité qu'elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de son ménage.

Aujourd’hui, elle a pour ambition de renforcer son activité et d'améliorer son revenu afin de pouvoir surpporter convenablement les charges du ménage. Pour cela, elle sollicite un appui financier d'un montant de $1200. Ce crédit servira de fonds de commerce pour la vente des produits d'alimentation générale et de boissons. Elle dispose d'une grande expérience dans le domaine et pourra mener à bien son activité.

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en: I am the mother of four children, two daughters and two sons, all of whom study. I feel it is important to educate them in order to make them better human beings who can earn a good living for themselves. To support my husband ( who works as a daily wage laborer), I started  stitching clothes for my neighborhood clients since I got married .As my children are growing, so are their needs and we feel the need of extra income. Therefore, I have decided to expand my business, and offer peco and over-lock facilities to my clients in addition to stitching. I need a loan of USD 250 to buy a new stitching machine that can make peco and over-lock as well.

loans.use: Buy a latest stitching machine

loans.name: Valentina Paulino

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has three children, two boys and a girl, each a year apart at fourteen, fifteen, and sixteen years old. While her children are at school, Valentina’s house becomes a neighborhood beauty salon. Valentina sells an assortment of shampoos, perfumes, hairbrushes, and other styling products for the makeovers her clients receive in her home.

Valentina has operated her business for one year but had no access to capital before now and was not certain that investing in her business was a viable option. She plans on using her loan to offer new and varied styling and beauty products, particularly fashionable hair accessories. Valentine hopes that she will one day own a “modern salon” where she can accommodate dozens of customers with a full-service staff.

loans.use: Purchase of new beauty products

loans.name: Sua

texts.en: Sua is one of the longest standing members of the Faatoia C Center. She is 49 years of age and presently resides in Faatoia village. She has a flea market business; she sells vegetables and general goods just in front of her house. Her main customers are people passing by and the village people. She earns $200.00-$300.00 WST ($80-120) a week. The money she earns supports her entire family; they have no other income. Sua would like this loan to restock her flea market stall.

loans.use: To restock her flea market stall

loans.name: Yakuwa Wakimese B Group

texts.en:
Annet is 29 years old and married with four children. She has a retail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to add to her capital and also pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the shop

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is married and has seven children. Cattle rearing is what he does to get income.

The previous loans enabled Abubakar to increase his livestock by two cows. He is now requesting a larger loan to purchase and sell more cows.

Abubakar said if he can purchase two or three cows bi-weekly and sell them, he would get a good profit.

His plan is to increase his business and also family livestock. Abubakar is 48 years old.

loans.use: Abubakar needs to increase the number of cattle he can buy and sell in order to support his family.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru:
Firuz H. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 24 years old and single. Firuz has a college degree in engineering. He works as an engineer at the local power plant but his salary is very small and he supplement it by raising cattle. Firuz owns a barn where he keeps calves, that he purchases at the market, fattens and then sells for a higher price. This helps him support himself and his parents. Firuz wants to buy additional animals but for that he needs to take out this loan. Currently the prices on cattle are lower, since the animals are thinner after the winter. Firuz is planning to pay back the credit in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Хафизов Фируз Абдулазизович житель Варзобского района. Клиенту 24 года , холост , детей не имеет. Образование высшее. По специальности инженер. Он работает инженером электростанции. Получает небольшую заработную плату. Подрабатывает клиент путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник ,в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиент хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Missefan Agadon Group

texts.fr:
The present micro-project concerns the transformation of cassava root into cassava flour, called gari in Benin. This project is the initiative of the women's group MISSEFAN-AGADON, created in 1995 and composed of five members. It is located in KPANOU- KPADE in the D’AKPRO -MISSERETE community, which is a border community of the capital of Benin. This micro-project will enable the increase of production capacity of the group, the making of a profit, and the improvement of living conditions of its members.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Le présent micro-projet porte sur la transformation de manioc en farine de manioc appelée gari au BENIN. Il est l’initiative du groupement féminin MISSEFAN-AGADON crée en 1995 et composé de 5 membres. Il est situé à KPANOU-KPADE dans la commune D’AKPRO -MISSERETE qui est une commune frontalière à la capitale du BENIN. Ce micro-projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager un bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres.

loans.use: To buy 12 tons of cassava tubers

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a married man and the father of two children. One the children is in school. Jacob is a Sprayer and has been spraying people’s vehicles for four years.  Jacob will use his loan to buy more sand paper, filla, tinner and other spraying materials to enable him expand his operation. He hopes to use part of the loan also to support his wife in her seamstress business. Jacob is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Members agree to guarantee for each as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy sand paper, filla, tinner and vehicle spraying materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and other products to re-sell in a successful and well-established shop

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in 1978, Mrs. Akossiwa E. abandoned her studies very early and gave herself over to field work with her husband. Married and the mother of three (3) children, she became attached to this work which provides income to help her support the very basic needs of her family. A very energetic and honest woman, she is requesting a loan to expand her farmable land and thus increase her income. By doing so, she will be able to provide for her family in a more satisfactory manner.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1978, Madame E. Akossiwa abandonne très tôt ses études et s’est livrée aux travaux champêtres avec son mari. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants s’est attachée à ces activités qui lui procurent de revenus qui l’aident à subvenir au minimum vital de sa famille. Très dynamique et honnête, elle sollicite un financement pour accroître sa surface cultivable de facto ses revenus. De ce fait elle pourra subvenir de façon satisfaisante à sa famille.

loans.use: To expand her farmable land

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children ages 2, 11 and 14. She owns her own charcoal and clothing business. Every day, she works from 5AM to 4PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $25 from her sales.

In the past, Raya has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Raya is now requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and clothing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Houn P., 51, is a widow living with her two children. She makes various types of baskets and sells them in Siem Reap. She typically makes a profit of US$2 per day. She is also aided by the support of her employed children. One of her children is a waiter in a local restaurant; the other is a customs service officer at the airport. Her son who works in the restaurant would like to begin a new transportation service business. Houn P. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a tuk-tuk (a three wheeled motortaxi that transports customers in its carriage) for her son to operate his transportation service. The family believes the income generated from this business will be much better than working at the restaurant and he can transport people to and from the airport for a steady stream of customers.

loans.use: Purchase a tuk tuk for her son

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Kokou est né en 1973 à Tékponou dans la préfecture de Vo. Tailleur de profession, il est marié et père de deux enfants. Pour survivre, il s’est adonné à l’agriculture car le métier de tailleur ne l’occupe pas en plein temps.

Mais les terres de sa localité étant généralement très pauvres, il a besoin d’y mettre du fertilisant afin d’avoir un rendement acceptable. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit. Ceci va lui permettre d'augmenter ses revenus et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in 1973 in Tékponou in the Vo Prefecture. A trained tailor, he is married and the father of 2 children. In order to survive, he has begun to work in agriculture since he is not fully employed in tailoring.

Unfortunately, the earth in his area is generally very poor, so he needs to use fertilizer to have an acceptable harvest. To this end, he is requesting a loan. This will permit him to increase his earnings and better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania. This is 43-year-old Mwazani M M.. She is a married woman with two children between 16 and 18 years old.

Mwazani has been running a tomato business since 2000. She buys tomatoes from farmers, brings them into town, and sells them at a higher price. Tomatoes are very common in Tanzania.
