Roasted tomatoes with onions can be mixed with cooked meat or fish or anything to make food more delicious. Mwazani’s business is able to make a monthly profit of about 500 USD. Now Mwazani is requesting a loan of 1300 USD in order to purchase more tomatoes. She is planning to open another business in the coming days. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #5 Group

texts.en: Iris A. is a Haitian women living in the Dominican Republic trying to better her life. She has one young child who she loves more than anything in the world. She came to Esperanza International without a job and without a way to provide for the child. She only has a middle school education and wanted to find a way out of poverty. She took out a small loan and received some help to start a small salon in her house. She since then has taken out three other loans and is now seeking her fifth! She has been growing her business steadily ever since her first loan. She said that she feels like she finally has purpose and can improve her situation, and most importantly feels like she can provide for her child. She wants her child to go to school, and hopefully someday go to college and live a great life. She someday hopes to have a big beauty salon from which she can generate a lot of money. She is excited about the future!

loans.use: To buy products for the salon

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeum S. is 25 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom Province where she makes a living by collecting chickens to store and then sells them from village to village in her community for profit. She also sells wood carvings. S. currently earns a profit of $4 a day. She is married with one young child, and her husband, aged 23, raises pigs from home. The young couple hopes to earn additional income to help provide the family with food and enlarge their businesses; thus they both need to request a loan of $500 to buy more chickens to sell and piglets to raise. (S.'s husband with her child are pictured because she was not available)

loans.use: To buy more chickens & piglets to raise then sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos; Zenaida de 21 y Wilson de 18 años y utiliza su trabajo en carpintería para hacer estudiar a sus hijos. Con 14 años de experiencia en el negocio de la carpintería, hace 6 meses, a base de mucho esfuerzo, logró poner su negocio propio, en el cual trabaja con un ayudante, quien realiza el trabajo más pesado. Su negocio es muy concurrido por las personas las que le hacen muchos pedidos, los cuales cumple a tiempo y con mucho gusto, ya que disfruta de transformar la madera en un bien útil para las personas y aunque los peligros están latentes en su negocio ella no duda en ponerle todo su empeño y sacrificio. Es el primer préstamo que Yolanda realiza con Microfinanzas Prisma y espera cumplir con todos los pagos y acceder a otro préstamo muy pronto. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cantidad de madera y por ende aumentará la producción de muebles en su carpintería.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in her own home with her two children; Zenaida, 21 years old, and Wilson, 18 years old. She uses her work in carpentry to send her children to school. After fourteen years of experience in the carpentry business she was able to, with much effort, open her own business six months ago. She works there with one assistant, who does the heaviest work. Her business is popular among the people, and they place many orders that she fulfills on time and with much pleasure as she enjoys transforming raw wood into a useful piece. Although there are hidden risks in her business, she has no doubts about giving it all her effort and sacrifice. This is the first loan that Yolanda realizes with Microfinanzas Prisma. She hopes to complete all her payments and have access to another loan soon. She will use the funds to purchase more lumber, which will result in her being able to augment the production of furniture in her carpentry workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of raw wood.

loans.name: Tika Shari

texts.en:
Tika Shari R. lives in Thikedewal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and four children. She has three sons and one daughter. All her children are now students. Her husband, Mr. Bhakta R., is in Saudi Arabia to work.

Mrs. Tika Shari R. is engaged in handicraft work. She makes different types of felt items, such as doormats, place mats, sweaters, caps and bags. She took two months of training to start her work. She sells her products in handicraft shops. Now she is requesting Rs10,000.00 to buy various raw materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam A. A. is 32 years old. He, his wife, and two children live in Gaza City in Palestine. He works hard in order to give his children everything they need.

Bassam has been selling women’s clothing in the central city market for about 6 years. Over that time, he has become very popular and has many customers. His business is the main source of income for his whole family.

Today, Bassam would like to ask for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new clothing to sell to his customers. You can be an important part in helping Bassam grow his business.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Isolda  Adilia

texts.es: La joven Isolda tiene 24 años de edad, vende variedad como golosinas, gaseosas, pan, también vende comida los fines de semana para obtener otros ingresos, reside en Villa Venezuela, y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en electricidad. Con esta solicitud va invertir en comprar granos básicos, jabón, carnes y otros productos de consumo diario para cubrir las necesidades del cliente. Con esto espera vender mas, tener mejores ganancias, sus planes es poder mejorar la  infraestructura del negocio para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isolda is 24 years old. She sells a variety of products, such as sweets, soft drinks and bread. She also sells food on weekends for extra income. She lives in Villa Venezuela and has a 5-year-old son. Her husband is an electrical worker. Isolda plans to use this loan to purchase bulk grains, soap, meat and other daily-use products her clients need. She expects to sell more products and increase her income, and hopes to refurbish her business to serve her clients better.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk grains, meat, soap and other products

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Муяссар  Хасанова 1962 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. На рынке торгует почти 6 лет яйцами. Поставщики  привозят её яйца, она оплачивает  через пару дней после торговли. Она сейчас открыла  дополнительную торговую точку  колбасных изделий.  Дополнительно дома берет работу с наклейкой бисер на  ткани. Кредит получила на расширения бизнеса. Благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Muyassar K. was born in 1962. She is married and has two children. Although she did not go to college, she has sold eggs at the market for almost six years. Suppliers deliver the eggs to her, and she pays a few days after they are sold. Muyassar is now opening an additional shop to sell sausage. At home, she also beads fabric. Muyassar took out the loan to expand her business, and is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Esperance.  She is 33 years old and lives in Gasabo district in Kigali city. 

Esperance is a widow and has a 3 year old child. This entrepreneur owns a shop that sells containers in Kimironko sector and she is seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company in Rwanda worth 500,000Rwf.  She runs the business herself with no employees. This entrepreneur has been working in the same business since 2005. She opens her business every day from 8:00am to 7:00pm. Esperance has a monthly profit of USD160. She is hoping to use the loan to expand her business and with the increased profit she hopes to buy a house and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adjo Agnès

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur et son revenu est insuffisant pour couvrir les charges du foyer. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer elle a entamé comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’huile qu’elle conserve dans des bidons de 25l. Elle veut diversifier son commerce en y associant le commerce de  tubercules. Elle s’adresse alors à WAGES pour solliciter son premier crédit qui lui  permettra d’acheter 8 bidons d’huile et 20 tas d’ignames.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a driver and his income is insufficient to cover household expenses. To help her husband support the family, she began selling oil which she stores in jerry cans of 25 liters each. She wants to diversify her business by adding the sale of cocoyams. She came to WAGES to request her first loan which will allow her to buy 8 jerry cans of oil and 20 piles of cocoyams.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of oil and cereals for resale

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Vicky is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a specialized business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from engaging in traditional gold mining known as pamiling. They work hard so that they can pan enough gold for the day and sell it for the needs of the family. Sometimes, if they have enough capital, Vicky is the one who buys the gold from her co-miners and delivers it to the city.

In 2008, Vicky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Vicky is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vicky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing goods for grocery

loans.name: Ahrorhodja

texts.ru: Ахрорходжа Юупов 1984 года рождения, женат имеет одного ребенка. Имеет среднее образование. Ахроходжа  является успешным предпринимателем. С нашей организацией начал сотрудничать  2008 года.  Он торгует строительными материалами. Его бизнесу помогает отец , когда Ахрорходжа ездит за товаром, отец присматривает за бизнесом. Пять лет назад он ремонтировал дома и ему пришла идея также и торговать строительными материалами. Теперь  по настоящее время развивает свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Ahrorhodja Y. was born in 1984. He is married and has one child. He has a secondary education. Ahrorhodja is a successful entrepreneur. He started working with our organization in 2008. He sells building materials. His father helps him with the business and looks after the store, when Ahrorhodja leaves to get his merchandise. He was repairing homes five years ago and came up with the idea of selling building materials. Today he is developing his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Carlos Felipe

texts.es:
Carlos  es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga
Carlos es  soltero no tiene hijos, se dedica atrabajar.
Carlos estaba estudiando matemáticas en la universidad  particular de paga, lamentablemente dejo la universidad  por falta de dinero, se puso a trabajar con una señora  haciendo pasteles y repartiéndolos  a las bodegas y mercados, el invierte en este negocio.
Desde que Carlos esta en Finca  tiene un apoyo económico, apoyo de las socias, aprendido ha  mucho de cómo funcionan los Bancomunales y  a ser responsable con los prestamos.  
Carlos necesita un préstamo de  de 1200 soles,  va comprar harina azúcar, leche, huevos para hacer pasteles. 
El sueño de Carlos es tener su propio negocio de pasteles.
texts.en:
Carlos is a member of the Jesús de Praga Community Bank. Carlos is single, and he does not have children. He devotes himself to his work. Carlos studied mathematics in a private university. Unfortunately, he left the university for lack of money. He started working with a lady making cakes and delivering them to stores and markets. He invests in this business. Since Carlos has been with Finca he has economic support, support from the members, and he has learned a lot about how community banks work and how to be responsible with the loans. Carlos needs a loan for 1,200 PEN. He will buy flour, sugar, milk, and eggs to make cakes. Carlos’ dream is to have his own cake business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, milk, and eggs to make cakes

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida T. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Nida owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to pay debts. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gie Kégnéto Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes des habitants d'un village de producteurs de fruits et légumes. C'est pour cela que nous sommes venus solliciter un prêt prêt pour nous lancer dans la production maraîchère qui est une activité que nous avons toujours mené dans notre écovillage. Nous savons que nous pouvons produire beaucoup de légumes si nous bénéficions de soutien et d'appui. C'est la raison pour la quelle nous sommes venus solliciter auprès de votre institution un prêt, afin de pouvoir acheter des intrants avec du matériel de jardinage pour que nous puissions nous atteler au travail dès la fin de l'hivernage. Nous sommes conscient que cette activité peut être très rentable pour nous et aussi pour les populations locales.
texts.en:
We are residents of a village of fruit and vegetable producers. This is why we’ve come to request a loan for launching our market-gardening production, which is work that we’ve always managed in our eco-village. We know we can produce a lot of vegetables if we were to obtain backing and support. These are the reasons behind our loan application with your institution, so that we can buy fertilizers, along with supplies and equipment, for gardening. We could then really tackle our work as soon as winter is over. We are conscious of the fact that this business can be very profitable for us and also for local populations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment plus fertilizers for market gardening

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Mary is a trader. She is involved in a local soap production business. She sells at the local market and supplies to other retailers in her community. Mary buys her goods such as soda ash, palm oil, etc. from nearby towns. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy raw materials in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy soda ash and palm oil for her soap production busines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilisers and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 46 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Margaret is a trader. She trades in textiles such as ladies’ under wears, infants’ layette, etc. She sells at the local market square and also treks to sell in other community markets. Margaret buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over twelve years and is requesting a loan of $700 to buy bales of textiles in bulk. Buying large quantities enable her to realize more profit for her efforts.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.en:
Sadridin is a very hardworking and responsible entrepreneur. He lives with his family in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is the loving father of 6 children. Sadridin works in the central city market selling men’s clothing, jeans, jackets and shirts. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 2 years. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Currently, Sadridin is requesting a loan of $800 USD, with which he will purchase inventory from wholesalers and thus increase the assortment of merchandise in his store. We believe that Sadridin’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur's business thrive. By lending, you can become an important part of the growth of Sadridin’s shop.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which began soon after it became independent from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients are able to borrow money. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: purchasing men’s clothing, jeans, jackets and shirts from wholesalers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is sixty years old. She is married and has seven children. All of her children have completed school and are currently working. She loves selling goods, the business that is the source of her livelihood. She has been selling fried yams and potatoes for about twenty years. She has her stock of yams delivered from farmers who supply her directly. This enables her to avoid middlemen, who would buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams and potatoes in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase yams and potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana A. es una mujer perseverante y trabajadora; vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijos(2 de ellos mayores de edad)y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja independientemente.
Liliana se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martín de Porres” desde hace un año. 
El primer crédito que recibió fuè de 300.00 soles, que utilizó para comprar gaseosas.  
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000.00 soles, que serán utilizados para la compra ropa de segunda mano y posteriormente ser vendida a sus clientes. 
La meta de Liliana es tener una fuente de soda con gran variedad en postres y refrescos.
texts.en:
Liliana A. is a persevering and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are adults. Liliana has the support of her husband who is self-employed.

She sells secondhand clothing. Liliana joined the Communal Bank “Fray Martín de Porres” one year ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy sodas. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy secondhand clothing to sell later to her customers.

Liliana's goal is to open a soda fountain where she can offer a wide variety of desserts and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Undraa

texts.en: Mayagmarsuren Undraa is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, or traditional Mongolian tent. Her three children, two sons and a daughter, all attend a local secondary school. Undraa operates a shoe-making business in her town with help from her husband. They specialize in producing many styles of traditional Monglian shoes and work well together, with her husband responsible for making the shoes and she in charge of selling them. The couple has succeeded in expanding their business over the years and are working hard to improve their products. Their earnings have allowed them to greatly improve their quality of life. Undraa says, “We are working hard to save some money for our children.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1,400 US) loan to buy shoe leather, glue and other materials used to make shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoe leather, glue and other materials

loans.name: Chheurn

texts.en: A small wooden house located in a rural area of Kampong Chhnang Province belongs to Mr. Chheurn K., age 26. He lives with his two school-aged kids and his wife, who works in the garment industry. From day to day, Chheurn K. works on his farm, planting rice and vegetable crops which he will sell to buyers when they are matured. In the past, Chheurn K. has hired a villager’s cow to plow his land but now he wants to reduce this expenses by taking out a loan to buy his own cow to plow his farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow his field.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
R. Mahmud is 36 years old. He is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many others in his grocery store which he built 4 years ago. Today Mahmud is requesting a loan of $1500 US to increase his stock. 

He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expand grocery store inventory

loans.name: Arcangel Gabriel Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”, ellos están ubicados en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a socios que se dedican a la docencia, en su mayoría son profesoras de nivel inicial y primaria; otro pequeño grupo lo conforman 4 abogados, otros socios tiene sus tiendas abarrotes, otra es trabajadora de una panadería, otro socio tiene su tienda de calzados ortopédicos, la última socia es enfermera de un hospital. Nuestro socio Juan Opisbo Meléndez tiene 8 meses en Arariwa y pertenece al banco comunal Arcángel Gabriel y su negocio tiene 2 años, para el socio fue un apoyo este préstamo que realizó ya que aumento mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes esto le permitió comprar a sus  proveedores al contado. Él socio nos cuenta que pudo comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite  entre otros, tiene mucha perspectiva sobre su negocio y le gusta que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesitan en su bodega, también está pensando comprar más productos y venderlos al por mayor.  

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “ARCANGEL GABRIEL” Community Bank in Cusco and are engaged in retail businesses. Some of them are teachers, mostly at the preschool and elementary level. There is also a small group of lawyers as well as grocery store owners and a bakery owner; one member owns a shoe store specializing in orthopedic shoes, and one member is a hospital nurse. Juan Obispo Meléndez has been in Arariwa for 8 months; he belongs to the Arcángel Gabriel Communal Bank. He has been in business for 2 years. The loan was of great help to him, as he was able to increase the merchandise he offers at his grocery store by paying his suppliers in cash. He tells us that he has been able to buy staples, such as rice, sugar, milk and oil, among others. He understands his business well and likes to be able to provide his clients with what they need. He is also hoping to buy additional products to sell in bulk. Our members are grateful for the opportunity and promise to pay back the loan according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member has asked for the loan to buy merchandise and improve sales.

loans.name: Andrew Muthaisu

texts.en:
Andrew, 41, is married to Rose Mueni, and together they have two children, Justus and M..

Andrew runs a cyber cafe/photocopy service shop, and this he has done for the past four years, with a monthly profit of Kshs 8,000. His clients are mainly in Malindi town, where he operates his business.

Andrew had a credit history with another microfinance and joined Kadet after he was introduced by a friend who was already a client. He has applied for a loan, which he will use to upgrade his photocopying machine and computers, repair his business premises and add stock of printing paper and files. With the extra income from this loan, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

A hardworking man, Andrew dreams of owning a promising wholesale business.

loans.use: Upgrade a photocopying machine and computers, repair his business premises and add stock of printing paper and files

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia M. es una señora con 42 años, apenas estudio hasta tercer curso de primaria, tiene 3 hijos, todos son pequeños, tienen 12, 7 y 2 años. Herminia y sus hijos  viven en Vilomilla zona de Sipe-Sipe. Su esposo los abandono hace un año.

La señora Herminia se dedica a la producción de leche pues tiene sus vacas, de las cuales ordeña leche y hace quesillo, para vender a sus vecinos, además se la producción eventual de haba, en su casita que le ayudan a sustentar su hogar y a sus pequeños hijitos. Las condiciones en las que viven son precarias, tienen una casita con dos habitaciones, su ganado en la misma propiedad. La señora Herminia se encarga de la alimentación, la educación y la salud de sus hijos, y realiza todas sus actividades con su pequeña de dos años. 

La señora Herminia solicita el crédito para poder mejorar la infraestructura para su ganado, y alimento balanceado de modo que sus vacas le produzcan más leche; la señora quiere cuidar su fuente de ingresos, por eso ha solicitado dicho crédito. La visión que tiene la señora Herminia es ver a sus hijos crecer sanos y fuertes, responsables trabajadores como ella lo es, poder tener mejores condiciones de vida, un casa con mejores comodidades, y siempre capaces de poder enfrentar cualquier dificultad que la vida les ponga en frente.
texts.en:
Herminia M. is a 42-year-old woman who only finished up to third grade of elementary school. She has 3 children, all of which are small. They are 12, 7, and 2 years old. Herminia and her children live in Vilomilla, a zone of Sipe-Sipe. Her husband left them a year ago.

Herminia works in the milk-producing businesses. She has cows which produce milk and she makes cheese to sell to her neighbors. She also temporarily grows beans in her home, which help her to maintain her home and her small children. The conditions in which they live are meager. They have a house with two bedrooms and she keeps her cattle on the same property. Herminia is responsible for the feeding, education and health of her children, and she does all of her tasks with her small 2-year-old girl.

Herminia is requesting this loan to be able to improve the infrastructure for her cattle, and provide a balanced diet to them so that they produce more milk. She wants to care for her source of income, which is why she has requested the loan. Herminia wants to see her children grow to be healthy, strong, responsible workers like she is, have better living conditions, a house with better commodities, and always be capable of facing any difficultly that life gives them.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a stable and purchase food for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Oleksyi

texts.en:
Oleksyi is married with a daughter. He is a farmer from Gladkovka, Kherson region. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers and potatoes in his greenhouses for selling retail in the marketplaces of his region. His greenhouses are built on his private land, which is his secure and reliable asset. Oleksyi built his first greenhouse four years ago. He has invested 40,000 UAH into this venture. Every month, he receives about 18,000 UAH of income.
Oleksyi is seeking a 10,000 UAH loan to purchase a drip irrigation unit for his greenhouses. He will also buy agricultural fiber, fertilizers, chemical pesticides and wood. Lending assistance will help him improve conditions in his greenhouses thus facilitating the growth of his vegetables and ensuring their timely ripening. Oleksyi has proved to be a responsible borrower who distributes finances wisely and always repays his loans on time.

loans.use: To purchase a drip irrigation unit, as well as other farming supplies

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is a widow and has two children. She has no educational background. Adjoa smokes (processes) fish for sale at Akotokyire. Adjoa uses the income she acquires from the sale of her smoked fish to educate her children.  Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more frozen fish to smoke (process) for sale. With the new income from her extended business, Adjoa plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more frozen fish to smoke (process) for sale

loans.name: Renovacion De Las Aguilas 4 Group

texts.en:
Briselda is the coordinator of her group Ronovacion de Las Aguilas (Renewal of the Eagles), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their child.

Briselda is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to purchase more cleaning products and laundry detergent to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, which she wants to grow as rapidly as possible. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Cleaning products, laundry detergent

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Don Mario es padre de familia de cuatro hijos,  de edad de 45 años, desde hace varios años logro poner su negocio la venta de ropa de dama, caballero, niños, ropa interior y una variedad de productos  con ahorro de su trabajo anterior, no ha sido fácil ya que la demanda es fuerte en el mercado los tramos están seguidos, pero todos vendemos, hay temporadas buena y malas, con la inversión de los financiamiento ha logrado buenos productos en su negocio lo cual le ha generado buenas ganancias,  cada día invierte mas para lograr el equilibrio de sus ventas y sus gastos. 
Las dificultades que la ropa que no se vende en meses se pone ala venta con descuento, es por eso trata de invertir en mucha moda para poder lograr las ventas y no tener mucha perdida.

Con este préstamo comprara ropa y zapatos juveniles para atraer al cliente y lograr el objetivo de sus ventas. Gracias al esfuerzo ha logrado apoyar  a sus hijos con los estudios y también los lleva a trabajar para que puedan adquirir experiencia sobre el negocio.
texts.en:
Don Mario is 45 years old and the father of four children. A few years ago, he used his savings from a previous job to start his own business selling women's, men's, and children's clothing, underwear, and a variety of other products. It has not been easy since the demands are intense. In the market, there are many stores in a row, but they all do well. There are good times and bad times. With a financial investment, the store has stocked good products, which have generated good earnings. Each day, he invests more to achieve a balance between his sales and his expenses. The difficulty is that clothes that don't sell in months are sold at a discount. Therefore, he tries to invest in a lot of clothing to make more sales and not lose a lot of money. With this loan, Mario will buy children's clothes and shoes to attract clients and meet his sales objective. Thanks to his strength, he has succeeded in supprting his children with their studies. He also brings them to work with him so that they can get experience with the store.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's clothing and shoes to increase sales

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban S. is 28 years of age, married to Mr. Chin, age 40, and they have no any children. To make a living, this couple leaves home early in order to buy fruit from the places where it is sold in bulk and bring it to sell retail inside the local market. By doing this, they are able to generate around $9 each day to meet the family’s daily expenses. Ban S. estimates that her current income will be not enough to serve them when their child is born. She hopes to invest in a new business line so she can earn extra income. Because she doesn’t have capital, Ban S. has applied for a loan for the capital to  begin a business raising pigs.

loans.use: To begin a business raising pigs.

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en: Namiq Q. is a 38-year-old petty trader who sells different kinds of goods in the small market of Agsu city. He is married and has three children. Namiq sells candies, cookies, cigarettes and other such products. He works from early morning till late at night. His monthly turnover is 100AZN. He would like to increase his income by purchasing more goods for resale. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 800 AZN.

loans.use: purchase more food merchandise

loans.name: Chivarretense 2 Group

texts.es: La señora Juana G. Ordóñez, tiene 4 hijos y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos tales como ganado Vacuno, porcino y bovino, y también crianza  de pollos ponedoras, y de engorde  y los vende en el mercado de la Aldea de Chivarreto los días miércoles, y en el mercado del municipio de San Francisco el Alto Departamento de Totonicapán, los días jueves a viernes ella  ha logrado logrado obtener buenos beneficios a todo lo que pueden emprender, por tal razón ellos con la iniciativa de incrementar sus capital de trabajo, decide formar un grupo y ampliar el capital de trabajo de cada una, y asi mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida. La coordinadora de este grupo ya ha tenido experiencia con prestamos y ha sido puntual en sus pagos para con esta institución ASDIR, y esta vez espera que los integrantes de este grupo puedan mejorar también sus condiciones de vida. Este grupo de personas son del Paraje Chichaj de la aldea Chivarreto del Municipio de San Francisco el Alto  del  departamento de  Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Juana G. Ordóñez has 4 children and a husband that helps her. She breeds animals, including cattle, pigs, laying hens and fattening poultry, and sells them at the market of the hamlet of Chivarreto and at the market of the municipality of San Francisco el Alto in the department of Totonicapán. Market day is Wednesday in the hamlet and Wednesday to Friday in the municipality. So far she has obtained a good profit in what she has undertaken; that's why she decided to create a loan group and help all other members to increase their working capital so as to improve their income and standard of living. This is the second loan requested by the group coordinator, who hopes that the group members will be able to improve their quality of life. The group memers are from Paraje Chichaj in the hamlet of Chivarreto, municipality of San Francisco el Alto, department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.en:
Maria Paz C. is from the village of Villa Corazon. She is 37 years old. Maria Paz is married and has two school-aged children. She owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Paz has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Maria Paz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Maria Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maria Paz is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maria Paz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children: two boys and a girl, all adults.She has been operating her business of selling Kikoi's (African wraps) and shoes for the last five years, from door to door and from home, to her neighbors and passersby.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of Kikoi’s at a wholesale price and resale at a retail price. She earns her other source of income from her husband's income.

Mwanaidi faces the major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business. Her major goal is to have her own shop in the future and be a supplier to the entire community. She decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans to improve her business and earn a living. She lives at her own house with electricity, but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are food, clothing and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of Kikoi's.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty T. is currently in the business of selling simsim, beans and groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell.  Betty is 24 years old and is married to a ZAO staff member. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her charcoal store.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel es casado con la Sra. Ada Paola Martinez, no tienen hijos. Don Manuel trabaja para ENACAL como maestro de electromecanica desde hace 8 años, ademas tiene un negocio de nintendo en su casa el cual es atendido por su esposa.

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de realizar mejoras a su casa ubicada en el Residencial, como es emberjar las puertas y ventanas para brindar mayor seguridad a su propiedad.  

El mayor sueño de Manuel es poder contar con una vivienda con todas las condiciones para cuando lleguen los hijos porderles brindar comodidad.
texts.en:
Manuel is married to Ada Paola Martinez, and they have no children. Manuel has worked for ENACAL teaching electromechanics for 8 years. In addition, he has a Nintendo business in his house that his wife runs. He is requesting his 6th loan with the objective of making improvements to his house, located in the El Residencial neighborhood, such as putting iron grilles over the doors and windows to provide better security for his property. Manuel's main wish is to be able to have a home with all the improvements complete so that when his children arrive he can provide them with a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put iron bars on the doors and windows

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Ramzan belongs to the city of Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan. She is 39 years old and married to M. M., who runs a small restaurant in the market where he offers food, bread and tea to his clients. He sells Punjabi dishes in his restaurant such as chanay (made with chickpeas) and Daal chawal (made with rice and lentils and served with pickle). His food is liked by his customers and they have become his regular customers because he has been serving them for the past 21 years.
  
She owns a three-room brick house in the area called Mughalpura and has been living in it with her family. She is the mother of five sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons help their father in his business while her younger children are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Ramzan supports her family financially by doing embroidery works for her neighboring clients. She does this work at her home. She is very good at her art and knows different techniques of embroidery that enable her to craft different embroidered designs on clothes to make them look good and attractive. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy food items like spices, lentils, cooking oil, rice and chick peas in bulk quantity for his restaurant business. The bulk material will enable him to serve better food to his client and increase his sales.
  
She is a new loan applicant and is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Ramzan.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk quantity for a restaurant business

loans.name: Zumrathon's Group

texts.en: Zumrathon E. is the leader of this group. She is 40 years old and married with a daughter and two sons. The daughter is married and the sons study at school. Zumrathon is engaged in cattle breeding and poultry. Her husband works in construction. When he is free, he helps his wife with her activities. Zumrathon hopes to obtain a loan because she needs money to purchase farm animals for breeding. In the future, she wants to increase her cattle and build a house for the first son. Dilrabohon A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 34 years old and married. She has two daughters and two sons. The children study at school. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 13,000 soms, Dilrabohon started to breed cattle. She makes 4,000 soms per month by reselling cattle after fattening. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two farm animals for breeding. Utkirbek J., 40, is married. He has three sons at school. Utkirbek works in tax inspection. He also breeds livestock to make money to cover family expenses. With money received from his loan, he wants to purchase livestock for breeding. Minurahon I., 27, is married. Her husband works in construction and she breeds livestock to make money. Reselling farm animals after fattening, she makes 1,200 soms per month. With money received from her loan, Minurahon wants to purchase livestock for breeding. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase farm animals

loans.name: Mercedes Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Cevallos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Éxito, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Para la señora Mercedes este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esta muy contenta con ello ya que gracias a los créditos pudo salir de unos pedidos que tenía y que no podía cumplir por no tener capital y que gracias al crédito anterior pudo salir adelante. Tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido 5 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y tres de sus hijos estudian y aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante.
 
Ella igual que su marido también se dedica al comercio, vende productos para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, colchones, etc.) su forma de venta es el sistema de cartillas, el mismo que consiste en enseñar una revista a los clientes ellos escogen el producto que desean comprar ella lo anota y una vez que allá reunido la cantidad requerida realiza los pedidos, los mismos que los recibe en la distribuidora luego entrega los productos y cobra semanalmente. Trabaja de lunes a viernes tres a cuatro horas por día.

Este crédito es para pagar el pedido que tiene para este mes. su deseo es tener su casa propia ya que vive en una casa que le ha dado su mamá.
texts.en:
The 'Damas de Éxito' (Successful Ladies) community bank meets every two weeks in the Cevallos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal, urban area of the city.

This is Mercedes' second loan cycle with the community bank and she is very happy because, thanks to the previous loan she received, she has been able to fulfil some orders which she was previously unable to fulfil because she didn't have enough capital. Thanks to her previous loan she was able to move forward.  She is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband with whom she has 5 children.  Three of her children are already grown up and two are studying and still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Mercedes is a merchant like her husband.  She sells products for the home (irons, blenders, fans, beds, mattresses, etc.) on request.  She shows her customers a catalog, they choose the product they want to buy, she makes a note of it, then when she has reached a certain quantity she places her order, receives the goods from her supplier, then delivers them and collects payments weekly.

She works from Monday to Friday, for three or four hours a day.

This loan will be used to pay for the order which she has for this month.  Her wish is to have her own house since she lives in a house which her mother gave to her.

loans.use: To buy irons, blenders, beds, mattresses, etc.

loans.name: Isac

texts.es: Isac tiene 19 años, es soltero, vive con su padre y su hermana en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 1 año se dedica al transporte, ya que cuando era adolescente se capacitó para chofer, ahora trabaja diariamente, brindando el servicio de transporte, cuyo vehículo que conduce le pertenece a su padre y que le cedió en calidad de alquiler. Por otro lado también trabaja en la crianza de animales menores que vende ocasionalmente a los que le solicitan. Siempre trabajó con un buen empeño, permitiéndole obtener más ganancias y mayor  tiempo de trabajo útil del auto que maneja, es por esa razón que desea tener su propio carro. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de llantas nuevas para el carro, asimismo pagar el mantenimiento mecánico del mismo.
texts.en: Isac is 19 years old, single and lives at his parents' home with his father and sister. He has been working in transportation for one year. As a teenager he trained to be a driver. He now works daily providing transportation services. The vehicle he drives belongs to his father but he rents it from him. In addition, he also works on raising small livestock and sells occasionally to those who inquire. He has always worked with great effort which has allowed him to make more profits and to have a more useful working time from his car. This is why he wants to have his own car. This is the first loan he has obtained from field partner MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support and thanks all the people who will be funding the loan he is requesting as it will be very useful in advancing his business. He will invest the loan he is requesting in purchasing new tires for his car and to pay for mechanical maintenance.

loans.use: Purchase tires and pay for mechanical maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Juana De Fatima

texts.es:
Juana de 31 años, es enfermera y vive con su esposo y tres hijos en una casa que es de ladrillos y que contiene como servicios básicos agua y luz. Vive en un lugar que está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Ella es enfermera su trabajo lo hace en su casa tomando la presión de sus clientes, inyectándolos, identificando algún dolor etc.  Su esposo es cobrador aunque los dos trabajan todavía sus hijos no están estudiando y viven en el patio de la casa de la mama. Para poder mantener a sus hijos ellos construyeron una pequeña casa en la parte del patio de la casa de la mama ya que ella vive en una que es muy pequeña. Para tener una mejor vida ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, pinturas y bloques para que sus hijos vivan cómodos. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un lugar especifico donde pueda practicar con tranquilidad enfermería.
texts.en:
31-year old Juana is a nurse and lives with her husband and three children in a brick house which has the basic services of water and electricity. Their home is located on Guayaquil’s Perimetral highway, an area surrounded by a salt march.

Juana works as a nurse out of her house. She takes blood pressure, does injections, diagnoses illnesses etc. Her husband is a bus conductor. Although both of them work, their children are not yet at school. In order to have a home for their children, they live in Juana’s mother’s yard where they have built a small house. She also lives in a small house there. So they can have a better life, Juana wants to use the loan to buy cement, paint, and blocks so the children can have a more comfortable home.

In the future she wants to finish building her house and have a dedicated calm location where she can practise nursing.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, and blocks

loans.name: Adela Esther

texts.es:
Adela está aplicando para la renovación de su crediKiva con el cual adecuará su peluquería con nuevas sillas y capas para tratamientos de cabello;con estas inyecciones de capital de trabajo producto de su priemr credikiva se siente mas holgada para invertir y sueña con crear puntos de belleza para que su familia trabaje en estos negocios, principalmente su hermana a quien mucho ama.Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Adela no dude en ingresar al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/172777
texts.en:
Adela is applying to renew her Kiva loan.  She will use it to kit out her hairdressing salon with new chairs and hairdressing capes.  With these injections of working capital, a result of her first Kiva loan, she feels more comfortable to invest and dream of creating beauty centers for her family members to work in, mainly her sister who she loves very much.  If you would like to learn about Adela's story, don't hesitate to follow this link:
http://kiva.org/lend/172777

loans.use: To kit out her hairdressing salon with new chairs and hairdressing capes

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia C. is from the village of Public, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Nelia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and  snack foods in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Nelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nelia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and instant noodles. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delgermurun

texts.en: Delgermurun S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in an apartment in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Delgermurun operates an energy device trading business. She started her business in 2007 and has gained significant experience. She is a very talented and smart woman who can speak Chinese as well as her native language. She has been achieving small and medium tenders related to her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business by advertising through TV, newspaper and other media devices. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to use for cost offsets which have risen due to importing more energy devices from China.

loans.use: To import more energy devices from China

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly forma parte del banco comunal “El Altillo” ubicado en la ciudad de Puerto Montt.  Ella tiene una sociedad con un cuñado en la venta de muebles, él los fabrica en un taller que tiene en su casa y ella sale a vender y maneja la administración, desde hace 3 años. Tienen aproximadamente 9 empresas como clientes fijos, ya que sus muebles son principalmente para oficinas. También tienen clientes particulares. 
Con este préstamo comprará materiales y nuevas herramientas para mejorar la fabricación de los muebles.
Su sueño es tener una mueblería establecida. 
Vive con su marido y sus 4 hijos. Los 2 mayores son universitarios quienes trabajan y estudian, el de 16 años también trabaja y estudia y el menor de 10 años solo estudia.
Para Magaly Fondo Esperanza le da la oportunidad de surgir en su negocio y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
Magaly is a member of the community bank "El Altillo" which is located in the city of Puerto Montt. She has been in partnership with a brother-in-law selling furniture for three years. He makes the furniture in a shop he has in his home and she goes out to make sales and also handles the administration. They have about nine companies as regular clients as their furniture is primarily for offices. They also have private clients. With this loan she will purchase materials and tools to improve the manufacturing of the furniture. Her dream is to have an established furniture store. 

Magaly lives with her husband and four children. The two oldest are university students who work and study. Her 16 year-old also works and studies and her youngest of 10 years only goes to school. 

For Magaly Fondo Esperanza this is an opportunity to rise in her business and thus improve the quality of life for her family. Perto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region. The attractions of Puerto Mott are its beautiful green countryside, its uncrowded beaches, its gastronomy and especially the reputation of its seafood and crafts. It is also the gateway to the Isla Grande de Chiloe, rich in tradition and legend.

loans.use: Purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Santalat's Group

texts.en:
Santalat H. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 59 and married. Together with her husband, she has raised three daughters and two sons. Most of her children are married and employed. Santalat and her husband are pensioners; in order to earn money to cover their personal expenses they breed cattle. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding. In the future, Santalat wants to increase the number of cattle and then save enough money to build a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstanat http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Jesusita

texts.en:
Jesusita is a 60-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a dressmaking/tailoring business. She lives in San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dressmaking/tailoring business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,600. Jesusita is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase raw materials. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jesusita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mirna Del Socorro

texts.es: Mirna Del Socorro tiene 40, su actividad económica es la venta de piñata y elaboración, por lo que tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Por lo que es la primera experiencia que obtiene con los financiamientos, ella distribuye sus productos por encargos pues es así que obtiene más clientes. Ya que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el capital suficiente. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de papeles, globos, tinajas, cintas entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de sus piñatas.
texts.en:
Mirna Del Socorro, 40, makes piñatas to sell.  She’s been in this business for four years.  This is her first experience with loans.  She sells her items based on prior orders since that’s the way she gets more customers.  At the beginning it was very difficult because she lacked sufficient capital.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy paper, balloons, clay pots and streamers, among other things needed to make piñatas.

loans.use: To buy piñata-making materials and supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Delia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Benito Enrique

texts.es:
El Sr. Z. trabaja para la alcaldía de la paz centro desde hace 9 años como encargado de proyectos
Es el quinto crédito que solicita en ceprodel este crédito lo utilizara para gastos personales
En la actualidad está casado y junto a su esposa quien es profesora comparten los gastos del hogar ya que sus hijos estudian los cuales son tres
Comenta que los créditos con ceprodel le han ayudado ya que gracias a ellos logro terminar de construir su casa
texts.en:
Sr. Z. has worked for the city of La Paz for 9 years.  
He is in charge of projects. 
This is his fifth Ceprodel loan and he wants it to pay personal expenses.  
He and his wife, a teacher, share household expenses and school fees for their three children. 
He says that Ceprodel loans have helped him build his house.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es:
Ana Miriam, resiD. en Berlín, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, tiene casa propia, donD. vive con sus dos hijos D. 14 y 17 años; El negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Berlín, su horario D. atención es D. 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra D. aceite, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, detergentes y sopas, esta compra le ayudara a tener más mercadería en el negocio y brindar un servicio más completo a los clientes.
Su aspiración es estabilizarse en el negocio, contar con mejores ganancias y satisfacer a la clientela, D. esta manera estará ayudando a sus hijos para superarse.
texts.en:
Ana Miriam lives in Berlín, which is located in Usulután. She sells basic needs products. She has her own house, where she lives with her two children who are 14 and 17 years old. Her business is located in the municipal market of Berlín. Her business hours are from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm.
She is asking for the loan to buy oil, sugar, beans, corn, detergents, and soups. This purchase will help her to have more merchandise in the store and to bring a more complete service to her customers.
Her aspiration is to establish herself in her business, to make higher earnings, and to satisfy her clientele. In this way she will be helping her children to better themselves.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, beans, corn, detergents, and soups.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
ector es un jovén solterode 19 años de edad que vive en la cas de sus padres, la cual tiene sólo servicio de luz, ubicado en el centro poblado (lugar donde viven pocas familias) de Chacupe bajo que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria y se encuentra a unos minutos del distrito de Chiclayo.  En éste centro poblado se desarrolla la actividad de la agricultura.

Hector se dedica desde hace 2 años aproximadamente a la actividad agricola en los terrenos que su padre le a dado para cultiuvar camote y maiz.  Son alimentos consumidos diariamente por lospobladores y muy ricos en distintas formas de preparación.  Una vez que cosecha sus productos los lleva a ofrecerlos al mercado minorista y mayorista de los diferentes distritos y con el dinero que recaude ayuda a su familia a solventar sus necesidades.

A  solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar abono para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y también su producto, ya que mas adelante al realizar la venta de sus productos podrá cubrir su préstamo y todas las nececidades que tenga en su casa con la única intensión de mejorar.

A pesar de ser una persona muy jóven Hector es muy empeñoso, responsable, honesto y trata de ayudar  a su padre en el cultivo de camote y maíz, con el único fin de que más adelante tenga sus propias tierras y cultivos.
texts.en:
Hector is a young single man, 19 years old, who lives in his parents' house, which has only electric service. The house is located in the small town of Chacupe Bajo, which is in Victoria District and is a few minutes from Chiclayo District. Agriculture is the main activity in this small town.

For about two years Hector has farmed the fields his father gave him for growing sweet potatoes and corn. These foods are eaten daily by the townspeople, can be cooked in several ways, and are very tasty. When he harvests his products he takes them to sell at wholesale and retail markets in the various districts, and he uses the money he earns to help his family meet their needs.

Hector has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles to buy fertilizer so he can improve his fields and his products. He has done this because later, when he sells his products, he can repay the loan and cover the needs they have at home. Hector wants only to make things better.

Despite his youth Hector is very hard-working, responsible, honest, and he tries to help his father grow sweet potatoes and corn. His only goal is to later have his own fields and crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and works hard to support her family in the Philippines. For twelve years she has bought and sold scrap materials.

Marilou has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials such as empty bottles, iron, plastic, etc. to sell. In the future, Marilou would like to expand her business and repair and renovate her family’s home.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Nzioka

texts.en:
Nzioka is 30 years old and married. He has one child.  

Previously, he was selling cakes, but he opened a retail shop after getting capital. It has been five years since he started operating the retail shop. 

Nzioka has used the business skills that he learned from the training conducted by Faulu Kenya to improve his business. He hopes to expand his shop into wholesale in the future. He has requested 32,000 KES to buy another refrigerator for his shop.

loans.use: To buy another refrigerator.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: harina, leche, azúcar, fideos  y otros, para su venta en la tienda. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Martha owns a grocery store.  She needs a loan to buy merchandise such as flour, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell in her store.  She lives in her own home, in Alto Irpavi district, in the city of La Paz.  Martha is married and has two children.  She has been a client of ours since 2008.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar, noodles and other products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Gabriel se encuentra localizado en L. comunidad D. Amacuitlapilco, Jonacatepec, en el estado D. Morelos, México, está conformado por 10 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes son L. señora Adelina va a comprar cosméticos, labiales por mayoreo, L. señora Adelfina va a comprar D. todo tipo D. dulces, L. señora Salustia va a comprar verduras y frutas D. temporada, L. señora Margarita va a comprar masa, chales, requesón para elaborar tlacoyos, las señoras Maura y María van a comprar cerdos para criarlos, L. señorita Blanca va a comprar vasos, gelatinas, para prepararlas, L. señora Salustia va a comprar pan por mayoreo, L.  señora Alicia va a comprar maíz para pozole, carne y verduras para tostadas, L. señora Marilú va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo. L. señora Marilú tiene 34 años D. edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año D. primaria tiene su certificado, elL. es casada tienen 2 hijos Humberto tiene 12 años  estudia el 6º. Año D. primaria y Héctor Manuel D. 6 años D. edad  estudia el primer año D. primaria,  elL. tiene su negocio D. ventas D. zapatos por catalogo D. L. marca Class, Andrea, Zone, elL. solicito su préstamo para comprar zapatos D. dama, caballero y niños para surtir sus pedidos, sus clientes son las muchachas y las señoras, elL. sale caminando a ofrecer los zapatos a sus clientes zapatos D. dama, caballero, niños y niñas, elL. inicio su negocio hace 2 años se fue a suscribir  a Jonacatepec, elL. solita aprendió a manejar todo lo del negocio, le intereso vender zapato y está orgullosa cuando le va bien y le pagan al contado sus zapatos obteniendo ganancias, sus planes y esperanzas son seguir vendiendo, elL. quisiera poner un negocio D. zapatos bien establecido y que sus hijos sigan estudiando, elL. está feliz con este préstamo porque va a invertir comprando zapatos, Amacuitlapilco es un pueblo tradicional en el mes D. Marzo celebran el día D. San Gabriel, también festejan el 5º. Domingo D. cuaresma hay procesión en L. tarD., también siembran en temporal sorgo, maíz, y D. riego frijol y calabaza. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por estimular a las personas con sus préstamos ya que nos ayudan mucho para seguir creciendo nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “San Gabriel” and is located in the community of Amacuitlapilco, Jonacatepec in the State of Morelos, México.  It is maD. up of ten women who know each other and are neighbors.

The members are Adelina who will buy cosmetics and lipsticks at wholesale, Adelfina who will buy all sorts of candy, Salustia who will buy seasonal fruit and vegetables, Margarita who will buy ingredients to make tlacoyos (oval shaped fried or toasted cakes maD. of masa), Maura and María who will buy pigs to raise, Blanca who will buy drinking glasses and gelatins to prepare, Salustia who will buy bread at wholesale, Alicia who will buy corn to make pozole and meat and vegetables for tostadas, Marilú who will buy shoes at wholesale.

Marilú is 34 years old and finished 6th graD..  She has her diploma.  She is married and they have two sons.  Humberto is 12 years old and is in 6th graD. and Héctor Manuel is 6 years old and in first graD..

She has a business selling shoes via catalogue of the Class, Andrea and Zone brands.   She requested her loan to buy ladies, men’s and children’s shoes to fill her orders.  Her customers are young women and ladies.  She goes out door to door to offer shoes for women, men and children to her customers.  She started the business two years ago and went to Jonacatepec to sign up and learned how to manage everything about this business on her own.  She became interested in selling shoes and she feels proud when she does well and they pay her cash for the shoes thereby earning good profits.  Her plans and hopes are to continue selling.
