She’d like to open a well-established shoe shop and that her children continue studying.  She is happy with this loan because she is going to invest it buying shoes.

Amacuitlapilco is a traditional town.  In the month of March they celebrate the day of Saint Gabriel and on the fifth Sunday of Lent there is an evening procession.  They also seasonally farm sorghum and corn and grow beans and squash with irrigation.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's shoes to fill pending orders.

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 38-year-old married man and the father of five children. He has been working in vehicle repairs for 20 years. He started his own business in 2010 to take a step forward in improving his family's social and financial situation, and he had all the support he needed to improve and prove himself positively.

Hicham is a man with a good standing credit history. He has partnered with Al Majmoua-Kiva for five consecutive cycles, which helped a lot in making necessary improvements to his business. Hicham hopes to stay capable of working at repairing and painting vehicles, in addition to taking good care of his family.

loans.use: To buy necessary paints and equipment

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac, tiene la edad de 29 años, está casado  y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para asistir un almacigo de café que él posee. El cuenta con un almacigo de café ya establecido para la venta y el quiere realizarle una asistencia para mejorarlo. El quiere darle a su plantación de café una mejor calidad con esa asistencia y así luego poder venderle a sus compradores un almacigo de condiciones buenas para aumentar cada año las  ventas. El se estableció la meta de aumentar la calidad del almacigo y así generar ganancias para su bienestar y la de su señora esposa,pensando enel futuro de ambos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Isaac, 29, is married and lives with his wife who is his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies to use on his coffee seedling business.  He has a coffee seedling plantation already established for sale and he wants to assist it to improve it.  He wants to provide the coffee plantation with better quality with this help so that he will be able to sell the seedlings to his buyers in better condition and improve sales each year.  He set a goal for himself to improve the quality of his seedlings to generate profits for his and his wife’s wellbeing thinking of the future for both of them.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living alone. He has eight years of experience working as a music recorder. In 2005, he opened his own studio and started to sell the best recorded CDs. In addition, he rents musical tools and instruments to be used in special events and occasions such as weddings. With his requested loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase new musical instrument needed. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools needed for his business

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Apolonia es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera, tiene 6 hijos, ella esta en Finca hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en una carreta. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar mas mercadería para su carreta, agradece por los préstamos que ha recibido porque le permitió educar a sus hijos, en las reuniones D. su bancomunal aprendió a ser puntual y tambien sobre el ahorro y todo lo que aprenD. lo inculca a sus hijos.
texts.en: Apolonia is a member of the Primavera Communal Bank. She has six children and has been with FINCA Peru for 15 years. She sells cookies from a cart. She is asking for the loan for more merchandise for her cart. She is appreciative of the loans she has received because they've allowed her to educate her children. In her communal bank meetings she learned to be punctual and also about savings. Everything she learned she has passed on to her children.

loans.use: to purchase assorted cookies for her cart

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Marha es comerciante, casada y madre de dos hijos, cuenta con su pequeño negocio de ropa, cosmetico y otros accesorios.
Inicio este negocio con el fin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, lo que comienza afiliandose a la Avon y con dinero propio, lo que comienza a ofertar sus productos por catalogos. Luego para introducir mas productos, y variedad lo hace con financiamientos en Afodenic, en donde lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de ropa interior, ropa de dama, y cosmeticos perfumes, cremas, losion, vanidad, maquillaje, pinturas de labios a si como la compra de chapas, pulseras de fantasias. Logrando aumentar las ventas,y logrando mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Martha is a merchant. She is married and has two children. She has a small business selling clothing, cosmetics and other accessories. She started this business to help her husband with household expenses. She affiliated herself with Avon and started out with her own money, offering products via catalog. She then started introducing more products and variety with the help of loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, and she has had four loan cycles. With this new loan she plans to purchase undergarments, women's clothing and cosmetics like perfumes, creams and lotions, makeup and lipstick, as well as earring and bracelets. Martha is hoping to increase her sales and thus increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: In front of Abena is a pan full of ladies underwear. She sells these items by moving from one place to another. She is married to a mason and they live together with her two children. She obtained junior high level of education.  She wants to increase her sales by acquiring a loan from CRAN through Kiva to buy more underwear to sell.

loans.use: to buy more underwear to sell.

loans.name: Iveta

texts.en: Iveta lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Isahakyan.  She is single and has a high school education.  She has been a private entrepreneur engaged in farming for the past twenty years.  Iveta also supports her brother’s son by taking care of his medical payments.  She is a very hard worker and enjoys the life of a farmer.  She dreams of saving enough money to support her nephew's university education.  Iveta would also like to enlarge her cattle shed.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and some livestock.  According to Iveta’s business plan, this investment will increase her income by twenty percent.  She is pleased with microfinance, especially the well-organized disbursement process.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi has been making local soap in Elmina for 10 years. This soap is popularly called “Asumah Blows”, perhaps because it is very hard and lasts long. Asumah Nelson is a popular retired Ghanaian boxer. He was a great fighter and his punch could make an opponent weak.

Esi is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a mason. Esi supports her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to make soap to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make soap to sell.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is separated with one child. Jeanette is 32 years old and lives in Gala Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Jeanette sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000.

Jeanette has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jeanette hope to buy a service to use for her banana delivery.

loans.use: To purchase a fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married and blessed with one child who is in school. For the last two years, he has been running a cafeteria to make a living. He also does farming to increase his income. Stephen has employed one person to help him to manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as wheat flour and cooking fat. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and five siblings. He works as a hairdresser serving male customers at their request. His business income is very important as he supports his father. Today, Omar is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a car in order to ease his transport difficulties on his way to customers. In the future, he plans to open his own barber shop.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to ease his transport difficulties on his way to customers.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie, age 34, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has operated this business for 12 years. She sells such items as canned goods, shampoo, detergents, and soaps. Analie and her husband have three children.
 
Earlier this year, Analie joined HSPFI. She hopes to make improvements to her business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, soaps, detergents, and shampoo to offer for sale in her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, detergents, and shampoo to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children. She sells fish and sea cucumbers for a living. She has been in this kind of business for 10 years. She works hard to earn more and help provide for her family’s household needs.

Natividad has requested a loan to buy more fish and sea cucumbers to sell. She hopes to achieve her dream of succeeding in life.

loans.use: to buy more fish and sea cucumbers to sell

loans.name: Sevinc Mercan

texts.en:
Sevinç is married and without children.  She has been making and selling cakes from her home for a long time. She started off by selling cakes to her close connections  and when her customers were very much pleased with her products she started selling cakes to people in other parts of her city.

Sevinç believes that her love of baking will enable her to improve her products and that her cakes will reach a wider and more diverse clientele in time. Because of the increasing demand for her cakes she has been in need of more practical and professional equipment, such as a really good mixer. With her first loan from Maya she will buy herself a mixer. 

She would love to open up her own bakery in the future, a place different from your ordinary pastry shop, where she can sell the cakes that she has prepared with a lot of artistry. Sevinç says that her husband is very supportive of her opening her own bakery. All-in-all she is a very creative and driven woman.

I  think this sentence should say: With her first loan from Maya she will buy herself a mixer.

Translated from by Turkish Maya Staff and voluunters


Sevinç Hanım, evli ve çocuğu yok.  Uzun zamandır kendi evinde pasta üretimi ve satışı yapıyor.  Öncelikle kendi çevresinde satışa başlamış ve müşteriler memnun kalınca farklı kesimlerde de satmaya başlamış.  Sevinç Hanım, bu işi severek yapınca,kendini daha iyi geliştirebildiğini düşünüyor,böylelikle daha fazla kesime ulaşmanın kolay olduğunu düşünüyor.  Siparişlerini arttırınca, daha kapsamlı malzemelere ihtiyaç duyduğundan, çok iyi bir miksere ihtiyacı olmuş.  Maya’dan aldığı ilk kredi ile kendisine mikser aldı.İleride kendine ait bir pastane açmak istiyor.  Fakat rutin pastanelerden biraz farklı düşünüyor çünkü pastalarını sanat eseri gibi hazırladığını söylüyor.  İleride pastane açmasını eşininde çok istediğini söylüyor.  Sevinç Hanım,çok yaratıcı ve azimli bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy herself a mixer.

loans.name: Somié

texts.fr:
Somié est une femme âgée de31 ans. Elle est mariée. Elle n’a pas d’enfant.
Somié travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Somié a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Somié voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Somié is a 31 year old woman. She is married. She does not have any children.  Somié has worked as a retailer since 2004.  She sells cereals for all types of customers at her home.  She buys the products in Lome.  She works alone.  Right now, she does not have any problems.  Somié is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals.  She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Somié would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Sokchea is 27 years old and single. She is a garment factory worker and she has been in this job for five years to make a living. 

Sokchea has been with VisionFund for five years. The loans from VisionFund have helped her have sufficient food to eat and make a living better. Now she leads a group consisting of four female members in the village to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Sokchea will use the entire loan to buy construction materials i.e. cement, zinc, wood etc to renovate her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent and better house to live in.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for house renovation

loans.name: Meliyo

texts.en:
Meliyo is fifty-three years old. He is married and has eight children. Meliyo is a livestock farmer in Loitoktok. He has been in the business for twenty years now and gets a monthly income of about twelve thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be Meliyo’s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more cows and goats for resale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his livestock business. In future he wants to be able to do well in the livestock and farming industry.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua   lives together with the husband who is a farmer and 4 children at Abura.  Ekua  produce charcoal  for sale at  Abura, which she has done for 5 years now. Ekua  is a single parent and has 4 children  She uses her income  to feed and pay her children’s school fees.  Ekua  will use her loan to purchase fire wood  to  produce the charcoal  to  sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business  Ekua  will produce the charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: purchase fire wood  to  produce the charcoal  to  sell.

loans.name: Rusi

texts.en:
Rusi is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 64 years old, happily married, and blessed with nine lovely children. She lives with her family in the Litein area of Kenya. Her children are her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them with a better future. 

Rusi was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up, and she has been practicing farming for the past 15 years. Rusi always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows “Lelkina”, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. 

Rusi also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Rusi is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. 

Rusi believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her child a solid educational background. This loan will be Rusi’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is 48 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Remia is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Remia has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a potato and onion wholesale distributor at a local market. He learned the trade from his parents who practice the same business in a different province of Ecuador named Chimborazo. He started off small, but now he is a wholesaler and distributes to many store owners and people who have stands in local markets. He will use the loan in order to invest in new products such as limes, sugar and oil. Jose is from Chimborazo and has two children. He and his wife are very positive about their future.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new vegetables and other products for wholesale distributino

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Tina is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She lives in Katapo, POkuase, Ghana. She sells various items in her shop. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $800.00 to enable her expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta is a 34-year-old married mother of five children. Her husband is a construction worker. She makes specialty candies and sells them door to door in her neighborhood. Enriqueta is part of a collective along with Brenda G., who breeds pet birds and sells them out of her home. They are requesting the loan together. Enriqueta plans to use it to purchase ingredients and better cooking utensils. Brenda plans to use it to purchase more birds and birdfeed, as well as medicines to keep them healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

ENRIQUETA TIENE 34 AÑOS , CASADA 5 HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN LA CONSTRUCCION COMO ALBAÑIL Y ELLA HACE DULCES ARTESANALES Y LOS VENDE DE CASA EN CASA ENTRE LAS GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARCOS 4 JUNTO CON DOÑA BRENDA NAVARRO G. QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE AVES LOS CUALES DESPUES VENDE EN SU CASA. CON EL PRESTAMO ENRIQUETA QUIERE INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA SUS DULCES Y EN IMPLEMENTAR MEJOR SUS UTENSILIOS DE TRABAJO . BRENDA QUIERE CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS AVES Y ALIMENTOS PARA LOGRAR UNA MEJOR CRIANZA Y ADEMAS MEDICAMENTOS PARA EVITAR PLAGAS ENTRE SUS AVES.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Pomi

texts.en:
“My husband is a keyboard player and sound recording specialist. He works with a musical group “Sohney Darti” which plays at various private functions and parties. He earns $3 to $4 per day. I have one daughter who is 3 years old and I look after her. I want to educate her but with our current income it is not possible to pay for her education. My husband wants to buy his own sound system, which can help us increase our income by attracting more business for him.”

Pomi B., Pakistan

loans.use: To buy a sound system and other related musical instruments for my husband for his musical group  “Sohney Darti”

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.id:
As the head of the household, Pak Ketut D., is responsible for the livelihood of his 3 children. A husband from Kt Suarti, initially bred 3 pigs only with the intention of supplementing his farming work. However after seeing the great prospect of this effort, he enthusiastically expanded this effort. Within a year a breeder sow usually produces twice, bearing 7 to 10 piglets, each piglet on the average is worth Rp 150.000 (about USD20). For 2 hours each day, he set aside time for this, in the morning between 6-7 and afternoon after returning from farming. Currently, he already own 4 breeder sows of the local breed. This loan will be used to purchase another sow and a male breeder pig. From his earnings he can save more thus able to pay for his 2 sons’ education, already in primary and technical schools.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Pak Ketut D., sebagai kepala keluarga bertanggung jawab atas kelangsungan hidup ketiga orang anaknya. Suami dari Kt Suarti ini pada awalnya hanya memelihara 3 ekor babi saja dan menganggap usaha ini sebagai pekerjaan sambilan di samping sebagai petani penggarap tanah. Namun setelah melihat prospek usaha ini bagus dia berantusias untuk mengembangkannya. Dalam setahun 1 ekor induk babi bisa beranak 2 kali, dengan anak 7 - 10 ekor, sedangkan harga anak yang sudah siap di pisah rata-rata Rp 150.000 /ekor. 2 jam sehari dia meluangkan waktunya, pagi mulai pukul 06.00 Wita s/d jam 07.00 Wita dan sore setelah datang dari sawahnya. Saat ini Pak Ketut telah memiliki 4 ekor Induk babi Lokal. Pinjaman yang didapatkan digunakan untuk menambah 1 ekor induk dan 1 ekor pejantan. Harapannya dari keuntungan yang didapatkan dia bisa menabung lebih banyak dan mampu terus mampu membiayai dua orang Putranya yang kini sudah duduk di bangku sekolah SD dan STM.

loans.use: Purchase Breeding Pigs

loans.name: Rosa Katy

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Nazarenas," and she designs and makes jewelery which she sells to customers in the neighborhood. She also teaches jewelry making to a group of ladies in neighborhood groups in Bellavista city, and she also sells supplies to them. Her business is located in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province of San Martin state.

The recent loan from Manuala Ramos for 2500 soles ($620US) will be paid in 6 payments. With this loan she will purchase jewelry making materials to create earrings, bracelets, and necklaces, such as shells, beads, and colored pearls, in addition to thread, wire and needles necessary to make the jewelry.

Rosa is 35 years old and has 2 children. She considers herself fortunate to be able to work in what she enjoyrs and have a business where she can express her creativity as she herself creates her designs at her customer's request.

She has a goal to open a store where she can sell jewelry making materials as going to the coast to buy the materials is one of the greatest expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Nazarenas, se dedica al diseño y confección de bijoutería, la cual vende a clientes de la zona, y también enseña a confeccionarlos a un grupo de señoras de algunos distritos aledaños a la ciudad de Bellavista a las cuales también vende materiales para su confección. Su negocio está ubicado en el distrito de Bellavista, provincia de Bellavista departamento de San Martín.

El reciente préstamo que recibió del Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ( $ 620.00 ) lo pagará en 6 cuotas, con este préstamo comprará más materiales para la confección de los aretes, pulseras y collares, tales como mostacillas, cuentas, perlas de colores, los mismos que adquiere en paquetes, además de los alambres e hilos necesarios para la confección de sus joyas.

La señora Rosa tiene 35 años y 02 hijos, se considera una mujer afortunada de poder trabajar en lo que le gusta y en un negocio en el que puede manifestar su creatividad ya que ella misma crea sus diseños a pedido de sus clientes.

Tiene como aspiración llegar a poner una tienda donde pueda vender los materiales para la confección de la bijouteria, ya que el movilizarse a la costa para comprarlos incurre en mayores costos.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry making materials

loans.name: Taufaanuu

texts.en: Taufaanuu joined SPBD Programme early this year. She said that most of her family has all moved to New Zealand, except her, her husband, and their five kids.  Without relying on remittances from overseas, she applied for a first loan and she used that money to buy chemicals, fertilizers, and other stuff for her taro plantation not far from her house. To enlarge the taro farming, she has now applied for another loan to support her plantation and to fix the floor of her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Nabaziza B Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Jane  has a retail shop business. Florence and Hamida are stone quarriers and want to use the loan to re-invest in the business. Faltia has a brick-laying business while Harriet sells used shoes. With the extra business profits, Jane wants to purchase another fridge for her retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Aquila

texts.es:
Eight years ago, Aquila was left without a job due to the elimination of her position as a street vendor. She used to sell imported goods in the center of the city, but everything changed when the mayor of the district ordered the abandonment of informal positions. This is why she thought about opening a business in her house. Now her business is 7-years-old, and it is very well assorted. In spite of her age, she doesn't let tiredness lessen her daily labors.

Now she lives with only her 23-year-old son, who goes to school and works at the same time. This is why she usually manages her store by herself. Even with all of this, she still has plans. With a loan of $700, she will remodel her store and fill it with more products so it will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Fue por el desalojo de su puesto ambulante que Aquila se quedó sin trabajo hace ya ocho años. Ella solía vender cosas importadas en el centro de la ciudad, pero todo cambió cuando el alcalde del distrito ordenó el abandono de los puestos informales. De este modo, fue que pensó en abrir un negocio en su casa. Ya con casi siete años, su negocio se ve muy surtido. Ella, a pesar de su edad, no deja que el cansancio disminuya sus labores cotidianas. En la actualidad vive solamente con su menor hijo de veintitrés años, quien a la vez estudia y trabaja. Es por eso que la bodega normalmente la maneja ella sola. Con todo y esto, ella aun tiene planes. Con un préstamo de $ 700 ella remodelaría su tienda y la llenaría de más productos para que crezca.

loans.use: To improve her store and supply it further

loans.name: Kumush

texts.en:
P. Kumush is 35 years old. She is married with two kids. Kumush is a market vendor. She is selling fabric for sewing the national dresses, such as chiffon, satin, and others. Kumush purchases all the goods in the market of Dushanbe city, and sells them in the local market of her home city. As a rule, the majority of the goods purchased by Kumush are those already ordered by wholesale customers.

The business is rather successful, allowing her to help the husband support the family for the last three years. Today, Kumush is planning to purchase the new fabric for sewing the national dresses. She requests $600.00 for the term of 4 months.

She has had a loan before and proven herself as a reliable client. Kumush promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics for sewing the national dresses, to increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Elvia Domitila

texts.es:
Señora Elvia Domitila M. D. T. is 54 years old. She currently lives in Licapa, Paiján district, Ascope province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She has six children, one of whom is still dependent on her. The others are adults and help her with various expenses. Señora Elvia has three years of secondary education.

For a long time she has sold beauty products and with the profits she gradually bought merchandise such as clothing for adults, underwear etc. She has a market stall in the township of José Carlos Mariátegui- Licapa. She also delivers her products to her friends and neighbours who make weekly payments. In addition she sells herbal medicines.

She heard about the Manuela Ramos institution through the governor of Paiján who formed the Banco Comunal “Manos Unidos” where Elvia obtained her previous loan of S/. 1700.00. This loan was such a great help to her that she was able to invest in her business and earn some profits. A short while ago she used her savings to rent a plot of land where she has sown asparagus, a project that is still in progress.

She plans to pay back the S/. 1700.00 loan within four months. The money will be used to buy two containers of seeds and herbiciD. to be used as plant medicine. She is going to put in 20,000 seedlings. Her greatest dream is to have successful harvests and sell her produce to various factories.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elvia Domitila M. D. T. tiene 54 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Licapa, distrito D. Paiján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad - Perú; tiene 6 hijos, 1 depenD. D. ella, los demás ya son mayores y le ayudan a cubrir algunos gastos. La señora Elvia estudió hasta el tercer año D. secundaria.

Hace mucho tiempo que se dedicaba a la venta D. productos D. belleza y con las ganancias que le dejaba fue comprando poco a poco mercadería como ropa D. adulto, ropa interior, etc. ella tiene un puesto en el mercado del Asentamiento Humano José Carlos Mariátegui- Licapa aparte reparte su mercadería a sus vecinas y amistades para cobrar semanalmente también venD. medicina natural.

Se enteró D. la existencia D. Manuela Ramos por medio D. la Gobernadora D. Paiján; formó el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donD. obtuvo su anterior préstamo D. S/. 1700.00, el cual le fue D. mucha ayuda ya que pudo invertir en su negocio y D. esa manera tener utilidades con los cuales fue ahorrando hace poco rento un terreno en el que va ha sembrar espárrago, aun esta en proceso.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1700.00 para pagarlo en 4 meses comprará dos tarros D. semilla, yerbicida que sirve como medicina para las plantas y sembrar 20000 plantas. Su mayor sueño es tener un gran éxito con las cosechas, vender por las diferentes fabricas.

loans.use: Elvia will use the loan to buy agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for a catering service.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad Begam, widow of K. D., lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Irshad baji is a mother of six sons, all of whom quit school when their father died. After the death of her husband, Irshad and her children struggled so much. Irshad baji makes wooden sticks and wooden curtains which called "chikhs." Irshad baji feels so proud of her children because her children faced every difficulty with so much courage. As a result of their hard work, Irshad baji and her sons were able to buy their own land and, now, they are living in their own home.

Irshad baji is facing yet another difficulty. Her younger son has anemia, althought the doctors suggest that with proper treatment, her son will be fine.

Now, Irshad baji is applying a loan for her wooden sticks business so that she able to expand her business and provide medical treatment for her son.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To expand her wooden curtain business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is a 34-year-old trader. She is married with three children. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children to give them a better future life. Selina owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With an increased stock of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to a community group called “Nyame ye odo” (meaning God is love) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Chanthy, 41, sells Cambodian noodles (Nom Banhchok). It is a popular food in her town market. She makes noodles and mixes them with ingredients such as vegetables. She always gets up early in the morning to take her noodles to sell in the market. She lives with her husband and four children. All of her children are young and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Svay Sokhom, is a soldier.

Because of the family’s increasing expenses, Chanthy needs to expand her business to increase her income. She wants a motorcycle taxi for her husband to drive. She would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase more rice to make noodles. Chanthy's husband is pictured with the noodle-making mill because Chanthy was not available.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and more rice to make noodles

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S., 37, earns about $4 each day selling vegetables in the market while her husband (shown in the picture), a construction foreman who builds houses, normally makes around $5 per day. This couple has three children, all of them students. 

Mao is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Madame T. Kossiwa est née à Tétékou en 1947. Actuellement elle vit à Aného avec dix personnes à charge. Mariée, elle a pour activité principale, le maraîchage. 

Ne disposant plus de moyen pour acheter les semences, Madame T. sollicite un crédit  pour acheter les graines afin de semer cette saison agricole. 

Après vente de ses produits, les revenus lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Kossiwa T. was born in Tétékou in 1947. She currently lives in Aného with ten persons she has to support. She's married and her main activity is market gardening. Lacking financial means to purchase seeds, Mrs. T. is seeking a loan to buy seeds to sow during the coming agricultural season. After selling her production, she will use the revenues to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for market gardening

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija, quien está estudiando y es su razón de salir adelante. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que lo hace trabajar con un chofer particular desde hace un año, muy aparte trabaja como recepcionista en una institución privada. Se siente contenta porque su chofer mantiene bien cuidada su herramienta de trabajo, su moto, y es muy rentable porque dentro de la zona, para trasladarse a sus trabajos las personas recurren en su mayoría a un mototaxi. Lo difícil es no contar con un lugar apropiado para guardar su vehículo. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo a MFP. Con este dinero quiere mandar a construir un pequeño garaje al costado de su casa, así como también mandar a refaccionar su motocarro para que trabaje en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Lily is 26 years old, is single, and lives with her daughter, who is studying and is her reason for going forward. She owns a motor car, which she has used to work with a particular driver for a year. Apart from this, she works as a receptionist in a private institution. She is glad that her driver maintains the motor car well. This is very profitable because inside the area, people use the motor car a lot to travel to their jobs. The difficult thing is not having an appropriate place to keep her vehicle. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from MFP. With this money, she wants to build a small garage next to her house. She would also like to restore her motor car so that it can work at an optimal level.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constuction of a garage to park her vehicle

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos # 4 Group

texts.en: Sosiana M. is married with five children who was living in extreme poverty until she started a small business a while ago that has been growing since. When she came to Esperanza International she was living only off her husband's salary which was not much. She and her husband could barely feed such a large family, and she said she felt like she was not helping. She took out a small loan and started a business selling flowers and now wants to take out her sixth loan! She has always paid each of her loan payments on time, and has slowly grown her business with each loan. She now earns enough money to take care of her children and have them all in school. She also feels useful to her husband and knows that she has a purpose each day. She is so happy with the way her business is going and loves having something of her own. She and her husband are living more comfortably and finally can save some money to send their children to college. They pray that someday their children will have a good, comfortable life. Sosiana is ready for this next loan, and very excited about the next stage of her business and her life!

loans.use: To purchase flowers for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Choung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people living in Anlong Romeit Choeng Village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. For example, Mrs. Phalla C., the 44-year-old village bank president, owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods, hoping to increase income and improve family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Touch Sokea, is a wedding chef who has been hired by villagers to cook for wedding ceremonies, parties, etc.  They have three children, two of whom are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza vive en la calle “ Huancane”   de la zona villa Amor de Dios en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
La señora es separada, vive en casa propia junto hijo el cual trabaja particularmente

Trabaja vendiendo comida por las mañanas, en las distintas ferias de la zona en su puesto ambulante. También trabaja como ayudante de minibús por las tardes.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales de construcción para la refacción de su muralla principal del terreno donde vive. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Esperanza lives on Huancane Street in the Villa Amor de Dios zone of El Alto city. She is separated and lives in her own house with her son, who works. She works selling food in the mornings from her cart, in each of the street markets in that zone. She also works as a minibus (public transportation) assistant in the afternoons. This loan will be used to buy construction materials to renovate the main wall around her property. It is Esperanza’s first loan with Impro, and after evaluation she has been qualified to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to renovate the wall around her land.

loans.name: Tari Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tari Maiya D., a resident of Chappagaun, lives with her husband and two sons. Chappagaun is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband works in a private office. Her older son has a small business, and her younger son is in grade 10.

Mrs. D. is engaged in goat farming. Now she has four goats on her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her to contribute something to upgrade the living standard of her family. Now she is requesting a third loan of Rs. 20,000.00 to buy a few more goats and grains to feed them.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a cattle business.
